Review.Titre: I really don’t like your format
Review.Contenu: I really don’t like your format. But I haven’t found any other app that I like either.

Review.Titre: Many direct import connections do not…
Review.Contenu: Many direct import connections do not work, or work intermittently. The YNAB solution is to remove and re-add the connection, which is a complex set of steps. If you want to keep your budget current everyday, this becomes a cumbersome process. Mutliple contacts with customer support results in a cheerful but vague response that they are working the issue. If you check YNAB's status report on its direct import connection status, it details so many issues that it is a 19 minute read.Without a reliable direct import, the app is more time consuming than it is worth. YNAB may work for some but it also does not work for many.

Review.Titre: Bad UI/UX, Poor connections to banks
Review.Contenu: Poor connectivity to some banks, like Amex. Expensive for what it does. Bad UI/UX that has not been updated in years. Transaction matching is awful. Bad auto-categorization. There are many better alternatives on market now, it seems YNAB has been coasting on their early success and driving the price point higher every year without delivering materially more value.

Review.Titre: YNAB has a massive amount of missing…
Review.Contenu: YNAB has a massive amount of missing features and has been stagnant as a platform for way too long. I really like this platform but for the price it’s pretty unacceptable that it hasn’t seen platform growth in years. It has so much potential but feels like you built something 10 years ago and are coasting off it. If it doesn’t see improvement in many areas soon I’m done. For instance other budgeting software can login to Amazon to auto catalog purchases. Please look at other software on the market and wake up.Edit: In response to the response of this review look no further than /release-notes and just how many of these bullet points aren't user facing features and are things like "Another round of backend updates" "no visual changes" on loop. I get that the person in charge of writing these release notes has to be fun and cute with what is ultimately nothing new, it's hard to read all of these and try and claim like there has been any real progress in this app and this response isn't convincing me that's going to change anytime soon. I'll start looking elsewhere.

Review.Titre: New owners tanked it
Review.Contenu: Bank accounts constantly came unsynchronized, app became clunky, price more than doubled, but the customer service is still great. At least until the money grubbing new owners fire all of them for offshore customer service. Either way, I'm not sticking around to find out.

Review.Titre: YNAB has changed
Review.Contenu: Unfortunately we have had some issues that have not occurred in past years. All year our YNAB account has not been importing transactions via Plaid from our bank account. I have to enter everything in manually by logging into my bank account and inputting transactions that have not already been logged in YNAB. Honestly I could do that without a service charging me for really nothing except a template. I’ve been very disappointed. In the past years YNAB has been so helpful. Their customer service is great. I know the problem will be solved so I will continue to use YNAB as I have for the past 7 years.

Review.Titre: The desktop works totally differently…
Review.Contenu: The desktop works totally differently from mobile. Missing critical features like running average daily balance, progress to goals beyond categories, missing monthly analysis of budget to actual spend, leftover total balance, etc. desktop add works like mobile move. Mobile add overwrites existing amount. Documentation is redundant on some features but nonexistent on others and not written for complete newbies. Documentation suffers from curse of knowledge. Bank connections consistently break.

Review.Titre: They were review fishing
Review.Contenu: They were review fishing. Sent me an email asking for a review. This seriously affects how I view a product.Also, I miss when YNAB was a one time purchase, I dislike SAAS

Review.Titre: YNAB is good but this app is stagnant…
Review.Contenu: YNAB is good but this app is stagnant and no new features are being added. You can not even do basic reporting via the android app and it is missing a basic feature like a running balance on the account view.

Review.Titre: YNAB software should allow me to import…
Review.Contenu: YNAB software should allow me to import old data like from the last 2 years do I can analyze my past spending to help me prepare for my new budget.

Review.Titre: Amex UK
Review.Contenu: Amex UK - Unable to link account after updating connectioni paid for subscription to YNAB even though it is one of the most expensive budgeting software around but it allowed me to do what i needed including automatic credit Card imports. For one month now there has been an error in importing transactions from Amex  and i am now wondering whether it is actually worth the value i paid for One year. The whole point of me subscribing to YNAB was because importantly that i could import alot of my transactions saving me time to manually input transactions.I am bitterly dissapointed with the service i am getting which is definately not the service i paid a premium to YNAB for. i rely alot on YNAB and i am left dissapointed.

Review.Titre: Price…
Review.Contenu: It was way too expensive for the benefits received,  price skyrocketed but being outside the direct import zone meant it was no longer worth it

Review.Titre: My Fidelity accounts will not sync
Accounts don't update
Review.Contenu: I love the idea of ynab, but my account transactions haven't updated in months, making my subscription useless. I've tried unlinking and relinking accounts, which has sometimes worked very briefly, and then they stop updating again.

Review.Titre: Can’t afford the new price all at once
Review.Contenu: Can’t afford the new price all at once. Cancelled because I don’t have the money. Wish i could still pay monthly

Review.Titre: Hard to use
Review.Contenu: Not easy to use and doesn't always pull transactions through....not a good system

Review.Titre: Too complicated
Review.Contenu: I could never figure out how to use their budgets

Review.Titre: No response or follow-up
Too complicated
Review.Contenu: Too complicated. Too much effort.

Review.Titre: Dificult to understand .
Over priced ass app
Learning curve is too steep
Review.Contenu: Learning curve is too steep. Make it more Intuitive

Review.Titre: Too expensive
too expensive
I've been with YNAB for several years
Review.Contenu: I've been with YNAB for several years.  The budgeting concepts are good; and, I do recommend that you buy the book and implement the four rules in your budgeting process.The company is not to be trusted.  The software has been buggy from the beginning.  Appeals to fix the linking issues have gone on for years, with half-hearted fixes and a vendor change to Plaid.  The vendor change wasn't adequately tested at the time, and charges were not being imported correctly (Plaid had a little trouble with debits being credits for a while there).  YNAB didn't even know it was going on when its users first started complaining about it.  Testing before implementation feels good, man. The recent treatment of YNAB customers over the price hike really was just the icing on a very old cake.  The entire debacle has been very telling in terms of how the company views its users.  The contempt of their customers was overt in answers to questions posed in an online forum.  They have never listened to their users' concerns in any of the fires they've had to put out over the years.  And they really don't have any intention to start.  YNAB does not value its customers.  It has continuously been the buggiest budget software out there, with no concern about fixing its own issues.Steer clear.

Review.Titre: Doesn't sync to Amex.
I feel like their recent patches are…
Review.Contenu: I feel like their recent patches are not really needed if we can have a vote on the features would be nice. Moreover, bank import is not supported for me but still paying full amount (not using USD as default currency) so I'm not really maximizing my payment. A lesser payment for lesser features would be nice

Review.Titre: worst customer service response time…
Review.Contenu: worst customer service response time ever!  Its been over two days now that I am awaiting a response from their chat help to relink my bank accounts.  Seriously ynab you don't have the dough to hire a few more customer service reps?????

Review.Titre: Lack of reporting especially on mobile…
Review.Contenu: Lack of reporting especially on mobile is a huge downside. My partner and I are joining finances and not being able to quickly review trends in spending has made us start considering other budgeting apps as our year renewal comes up.

Review.Titre: YNAB no longer works with my bank
Review.Contenu: YNAB no longer works with my bank.  I don’t really care who is at fault, I just need things to work.  Otherwise YNAB has been great, but I am close to dropping if my bank connection doesn’t get restored.

Review.Titre: Don't know how to use it.
Review.Contenu: It's a complicated software, I fumble around trying to figure out how to use it, your help support doesn't offer much in the way of help, and you don't have training.YNAB keeps warning me and this, that, and the other and I don't understand what it's talking about.  I just want a simple app that conducts an envelope budgeting system without all the bells and whistles.

Review.Titre: The platform is fine in theory
Review.Contenu: The platform is fine in theory - You're supposed to be able to manage your budgets and get updated statements, however, delays are often quite long (more than 3 days regularly and up to weeks sometimes), the imports don't always come in and you're never able to balance your budget accordingly (too much budget rolled over since imports are delayed or never show up. Though they have customer service, it's nowhere near as advanced as a regular SaaS company should be. I would expect 1-1 customer service (within set hours), who can walk me through issues instead of just pushing out their FAQs.

Review.Titre: Requests for Captioned Podcasts Remained "Unimportant"
Review.Contenu: I've left this review multiple times to different YNAB staffs and it seems to continue being ignored. SUBTITLES and TRANSCRIBE every single videos and podcasts, not only the ones that your team deems as the most important. When I say everything, I literally mean *everything* Deaf people have money to handle, too. I don't understand why it's assumed that we don't need budgets like hearing people do.

Review.Titre: I wish there was more opportunity to…
Review.Contenu: I wish there was more opportunity to learn about your finances specifically and how to apply them to YNAB. I can see how it can be a good program but I get lost in the mess of it all and there’s not many options for classes with YNAB these days

Review.Titre: They moved from a license model to SaaS…
Review.Contenu: They moved from a license model to SaaS pricing, so you're paying a lot more than you were for YNAB4. They charge a ton of money and don't make many improvements or changes, and when they do try to do something, it's often a poor design choice. They then proceed to ignore customer feedback.The app itself is useful for budgeting, and I'm committed because I've already used it for years, but at this point if you're starting fresh I would look elsewhere for a company that actually values its customers.

Review.Titre: Price of the sub
Review.Contenu: Im with ynab for 2 years now. It helped me alot. The thing is your price go up and up and up. I have nothing to say about the app, but it is ridiculous that you need to cut essential things to put ynab in your budget. It's like you guys lost the real purpose of the app. That's really sad.

Review.Titre: I wish there was a more affordable…
Review.Contenu: I wish there was a more affordable option. I would like one where there I just use the software without import, goals, or anything added in the last 5 years. I just want something to effectively use the envelope system plus look back at trends/past purchases.

Review.Titre: Worked great until it stopped importing…
Review.Contenu: Worked great until it stopped importing transactions from Amex for months.  As Amex is my main account for day to day purchases, adding everything by hand got real old, real quick.  Multiple support requests returned the same "working on it" response, so I gave up.  Once that problem cropped up, the product was no longer useful at all and YNAB seemed unable to fix it.

Review.Titre: YNAB4 was so good. nYNAB, not so much.
Review.Contenu: 1) The step from YNAB4 to nYNAB was a backwards step. I understand they needed to change their pricing model, but they did NOT need to change their platform to accomplish that.2) Early adopters such as myself were given a "forever" 45% off loyalty discount that they rescinded without notice and without apology.3) The new YNAB has completely deflated me and my personal finance rythym. I'm months behind and have no ambition to actually do much budget routine anymore. Just takes too much time (old YNAB was different).The company culture has changed. I wish there was a better option available for budgeting.

Review.Titre: Best budget app. Paycheck to paycheck peasants need not apply
Review.Contenu: Helps me keep on track with my budget. Literally the best app out there even though it constantly yells at me that I'm poor piece of crap for not having all the money for the month on the 1rstThe absolute lack of anything bi-weekly is baffling though. It's super duper duper condescending to anyone living paycheck to paycheck and don't you DARE have any bi-weekly bills. The solution is to split it in half and do it weekly. You can do custom recurs every x bills but only for months or years. It's such a weird ass stance they took. Instead they have videos and tutorials on how to work around their app if you don't already have all the money you need for the month on the 1rst

Review.Titre: Used to be good, now not so much
Review.Contenu: It used to be super helpful when I started. Lately is too buggy and slow to bring in transactions, I am considering not renewing after this year is over.

Review.Titre: Great tool, but bad direction and lack of improvements
Review.Contenu: Great tool, except company is out of touch with what users actually want improved within the app. For years users have requested improved reporting capabilities (arguably the most important item to visually understanding spending habits) and customization options within the mobile app and website... yet every 6 months they seem to release a niche use case 'improvement' (categories?). I love YNAB, but for $100 a year, lack of reporting and inability for auto import to function properly, I'll be moving over to another envelope based budgeting system. It's worth noting, the community introduced a Toolkit that provides a lot of capabilites YNAB should have... the code is available and yet it's not integrated..

Review.Titre: Good budgeting app but really too expensive
Review.Contenu: It helps me to track my spending and stick to my budget. But it is definitely too expensive ($15/month for new clients !) And we still waiting for multi-currency support: Hi YNAB team, we are in 2023 ! People travel, you still don’t know?

Review.Titre: I want to love YNAB
Review.Contenu: I want to love YNAB, I really do. I have really tried to use it a few times over the years. What I find most frustrating is the linking and auto downloading of transactions from my financial institutions. It has been a near constant headache of syncing accounts. I should try again.

Review.Titre: YNAB has had a big positive impact in…
Review.Contenu: YNAB has had a big positive impact in my life, and I've used it for about a decade, but it's no longer the darling it used to be. Big price hike but no noticable change in the product. I used to recommend YNAB to friends and family left and right, but I no longer do that due to the price. The price hike was particularly awful, given YNAB backtracked on their promise to keep YNAB grandfathered into the original price. Felt like a big slap in the face and a betrayal of trust. Regarding the product itself... wish I could attach receipts to transactions, make a budget template for general planning purposes, have better data visualizations for understanding my financial state, have better investment tracking. Syncing has never worked very well, and I feel like my relationship with YNAB is glorified data entry instead of letting me spend my time understanding and exploring and planning around my financial state.

Review.Titre: CANCEL After many months of subscription
Review.Contenu: After many months of subscription, I have decided to cancel it. *EDIT next sentence: THERE IS NO EASY WAY TO REMOVE YOUR SUBSCRIPTION, this is simply F** annoying and even a reason not to Subscribe.The mechanics for adding transactions are extremely cumbersome. If I scroll through my budget, it should be possible to click and add a transaction or simply mark it as "paid". Let me give you an example: monthly internet cost. I have to click on transactions, remember the correct amount to pay, for example 24.95€, I have to enter it, add the payee, add the category, add the transaction. Every category should be clickable and show options to change the budget, mark as paid, add transaction. Despite being extremely user-friendly, adding all expenses is very stressful for me. The budget should be modified monthly and only show the current expenses screen. I always use English for everything else, but this app, one of the few, I would have liked to have in Italian which seems to not be available. I breathe a sigh of relief to eliminate it. Before, I used a simple excel and added rows every day in a simple way. One column for the budget, one column for what was spent. Now I will try Spendee or Mint.😖

Review.Titre: Managing YNAB is a full time job
Review.Contenu: Managing YNAB is a full time job. I wish the program could be changed to common budgeting types. Not just a zero budget. The software is a tool for me to manage my money. I want it to let me manage my money  the way that I want to manage my money. It makes me categories that I do not intend on fully budgeting for the month.

Review.Titre: It is okay but could be better
Review.Contenu: I really loved the YNAB4.  It was awesome!!  I hate the new one.  I don't want my info on the online. I hate subscriptions too!! I also don't like that my cc purchases just disappear out of my categories for the next month and I have to look at my cc totals and don't know what category needs funding.

Review.Titre: As European
Review.Contenu: As European, I don't benefit from a lot of the development effort put into the product. The main feature lacking, obviously, being the bank account synchronisation. It's still a decent product, sure, but I don't get 100% of it, while paying the full price.

Review.Titre: My bank doesn't support Plaid so I'm no…
Review.Contenu: My bank doesn't support Plaid so I'm no longer able to use YNAB. I really am not interested in doing everything by hand.

Review.Titre: Great ... When it works.
Review.Contenu: YNAB was great for what I wanted, when it worked. I first subscribed in 2018, and I used it successfully for a while to set up budget categories, it helped me keep track of my recurring expenses and remember to cancel services I no longer needed. However, every few months, something with the importing would break. Sometimes some of my accounts just wouldn't import, and most recently I had an issue where all of my credit card charges would shows as duplicated positive inputs to my bank account. I'd get in to a cycle where I'd get everything set up, use it consistently for a bit, something new would break, and I'd get out of the habit of using it again while I was trying to figure out how to fix what was broken. I ultimately canceled my subscription this year in 2022 because the import issues were too much hassle for the budgeting I wanted to do. I still miss the service sometimes, but I didn't want to keep paying for something that I wasn't going to get much use out of because it kept breaking.

Review.Titre: Been charged twice!?
Review.Contenu: Absolutely love the app but the service it so bad! Can not get hold of them and they have charged me twice when I subscribed:(no chats available not replied to my message sent...

Review.Titre: For the first time ever
Review.Contenu: For the first time ever, I have been able to save money and cover future expense at the same time. The Four Rules rule!!

Review.Titre: to have such an expensive product does…
Review.Contenu: to have such an expensive product does not really ring well with selling ways to save money.

Review.Titre: Program is difficult to use
Review.Contenu: Program is difficult to use Never seems to stay connected to the bank Cost of program is to much. Will not be renewing for another term

Review.Titre: your price is too expensive!
Great Product, Needs Improved Refresh Rates
Review.Contenu: There’s a lot to love about YNAB! Intuitive, easy to pick up, and based on solid budget fundamentals. Only reason I didn’t give 5 stars is that their refresh rates from banking institutions is limited to once per day which can limit views into spending especially over the weekend. 5 stars for sure if they can move the needle on that.

Review.Titre: Love Everything Except...
Review.Contenu: I like everything about YNAB except the time it takes for it to sync with my bank and CC accounts. It's hard to track transactions real-time when the sync often takes 3-4 days to catch up.

Review.Titre: I am still struggling and get repeated…
Review.Contenu: I am still struggling and get repeated "you have assigned more than you have" alerts for reasons that are not obvious. I'm a loooong time user of Mvelopes and assignments methodology of YNAB is still mysterious to me.

Review.Titre: Great app that could be awesome with some changes
Review.Contenu: The categorization aspects are great, but linked accounts are fairly unreliable.  Using for one year I've had to switch from plaid to mx back to plaid because accounts failed to sync or transactions were importing incorrectly.  There are useful reports but I would love to see some additional data visualizations built out, more things like ynabexplorer.com instead of relying on 3rd party devs, so more users would see the benefits.

Review.Titre: Bittersweet
Review.Contenu: I feel bittersweet about YNAB. I find it expensive, especially that the bank account syncs are rarely working properly. I’m with four different banks and they all have issues loading my transactions so it’s not a problem caused by the bank. That being said, I like the concept of allocating money and how the interface is designed. It’s helped me a lot with managing my money, but especially for Canadians, it’s pricey, even if it was reliable.

Review.Titre: Love but!
Review.Contenu: Love but!Recently it seems like transactions are a bit more out of sync. I have also noticed is hard to track overspending on my credit card from past months. While I have reached out to support, it still seems like is not clear where the money goes and how to keep myself accountable for it.

Review.Titre: Only 1 issue with YNAB….
Review.Contenu: I have loved YNAB since day 1, but it’s getting harder to justify the annual cost, which has gone up. I would hate to do it, but every time renewal comes up, I consider using another platform or creating my own budget so I’m not paying so much to save $$$ 🫤

Review.Titre: It has been great
Review.Contenu: It has been great, except for an issue where my credit card hasn’t been able to link for over a month. YNAB is aware and working on it but it is essentially useless to me until that issue is resolved. Apart from connection issues, I love this app.

Review.Titre: YNAB is very helpful with this inflationary economy
Review.Contenu: When I first got YNAB I had all my credit cards and my credit union accounts connected with YNAB. When I purchased something I would enter into YNAB and then my accounts would verify and sometimes it would catch mistakes that I made. Now my credit cards still operate the same, but my credit union does not. The YNAB customer support team looked into it and tried a few things but it’s still the same. I would like to have this back to working like it did, but this tool is very helpful for me to not overspend which is very much needed in this economy today!

Review.Titre: It is a good budgeting tool if you are willing to compromise a bit
Review.Contenu: It is a good budgeting tool and a good application that forces you to think what to do with every dollar you have.It is missing a couple of things:1. Ability to budget in fortnightly periods. Currently the work around is either to calculate de equivalent in monthly amount or to budget weekly for it. Not ideal if your pay check is also received fortnightly.2. Automatic bank feeds for banks for other regions other than the US or Canada. I am located in NZ and the option is not available here. I am fine with not having these but then I think the price should reflect this and be less.

Review.Titre: I need more basic onboarding instructions
Review.Contenu: I need simpler, more basic onboarding directions. I understand the concept and have read the book. But the way the software works and knowing what I Sam supposed to do sometimes eludes me. Add to that trying to find time to decipher it. The instructions I found were only for more complicated circumstances. I’m not there yet. But I want this to work for me.

Review.Titre: I tried for a while to like this…
Review.Contenu: I tried for a while to like this product but ultimately ended up canceling. I think the concept makes sense and it's a challenging thing to make intuitive. I would have been okay jumping through the hoops but ultimately found that some of the integrations to my CCs were unreliable and therefore the value dropped for me because it's only really valuable if it takes up a minuscule amount of time.

Review.Titre: I like YNAB and have been using it for…
Review.Contenu: I like YNAB and have been using it for over 7 years and love that it helps me keep things on track for the most part. What is hard , is managing Amazon orders that involve multiple categories as well trips to Target for the same reason. Lastly the sync feature w my bank has a terrible lag. My credit card is fine, but bank sync is not good.

Review.Titre: Issues with bank connection
Review.Contenu: We nearly always have issues with Bellco not being able to input. And when it does work, it only catches some of the transactions. We have contacted people at YNAB about this multiple times, but this makes our experience not great We have to still manually input alot of transactions and cannot trust the software to input them all. This makes it very tiresome, but we don't want to switch to another software again because it's such a process.

Review.Titre: When it works it works, bank sync issues
Review.Contenu: When it works, it works well. We have had issue after issue with syncing items consistently with our bank and credit cards. I will  not renew, as every time it breaks the status is “we are aware of this and don’t have an ETA for it to be resolved.” If this was Mint’s free plan that might be acceptable, but as a premium service this can’t be overlooked.

Review.Titre: Not as efficient as the German alternative
Review.Contenu: Since after many years there is still no full support for most German banks, and editing CSVs (even using a script) is a lot of effort, I have changed to the German alternative Outbank - it is not as strong as YNAB, but it supports all (!) my bankds an thus makes it much easier to keep track of what is going on. I would love to go back to YNAB, but I need out of the box support for these banks including Depots:N26, comdirect, smartbroker (DAB), Wüstenrot, Blockchain

Review.Titre: Price hiked, product is the same
Review.Contenu: This year was my first year paying the new higher subscription price. While YNAB is a valuable tool for me, it's disappointing that as a years-long loyal user I was suddenly having to pay more than double what I was paying previously. They chose to capitalize on their oldest and loyalist base of users instead of working to acquire new ones at the rates that they wanted. The UI is clunky and (frankly) ugly. I still use it, but as soon as a better alternative comes along I'll be there.

Review.Titre: Needs more payment schedule options
Review.Contenu: I mostly love YNAB, it's helped me balance our finances and get back on track and I'd be lost without it. But, I really wish they had the option for bi weekly payments, as this is a common payment option for mortgages and car payments, and I've had to make up my own ways to make this work

Review.Titre: Long Time YNABer
Review.Contenu: Long Time YNABerFor years, I used the old version of YNAB.  Last year, I finally switched to the annual subscription.  I have been very disappointed with the linking of accounts to my banks.  They disconnect on a regular basis, and I have to go through all the motions of reconnecting.  It is frustrating and a waste of time.

Review.Titre: I've been using YNAB for over 4 years
Review.Contenu: I've been using YNAB for over 4 years. I started off by trying to learn as much as possible but at some point it became, let's say, not intuitive to use. I continue to use it in a very basic way but am trying to decide whether to dedicate more time to learning or try another software product.

Review.Titre: No longer worth the cost
Review.Contenu: No longer worth the costThe automatic transaction input challenges became too frequent and impactful to my budgeting cadence to maintain progress. The concurrent increase in price for a product with no meaningful new features and decreasing reliability will drive me to find alternatives.

Review.Titre: Love everything except…
Review.Contenu: I love everything about this app except the reports tab from within the app. I’m always mobile and would like to see a detailed report of my earnings and expenses right from the app like I used to do on Invoice2go.  I can only see Age of money and Networth on my App.  If I have any other question then I need a computer to find out the info I’m looking for.  I fix cars and didint need a computer for this before, but after wetting Ynab I have to use a computer to see the reports. It’s the only thing that really is bothering me.

Review.Titre: Expensive budgeting
Review.Contenu: Expensive budgeting. That's what YNAB is. Don't get me wrong, it's mostly a solid product. Excellent auto-imports via Plaid, clean UI, and easy to use - what more do you want? Well, I want it to be cheaper. $100 a year is too much to just budget efficiently. Also, customer service will ignore all feature requests. They should use a public ticketing or forum system to track feature requests.

Review.Titre: Amazing support team, issues importing
Review.Contenu: Your support team is A+, five stars, amazing people.  I've always had great experiences when I've had to reach out.  I'm finding as time goes on my import ability is continually broken, and now it is such a hassle to import my transactions I'm logging in maybe 2-4 times a month to do so - which defeats the purpose.  Especially given the cost hikes.  I wish I could rewind to the YNAB experience I had two years ago, and have it stay like that permanently!

Review.Titre: Wish this worked for me, but it doesn't.
Review.Contenu: Very expensive and too complex. I'm on my second year of using it and still haven't figured it all out. Doesn't link to/ update from most Canadian bank accounts. Overall it's pretty frustrating- if you haven't "got" it after the free trial I recommend using something else.

Review.Titre: I liked YNAB a lot more a few years ago…
Review.Contenu: I liked YNAB a lot more a few years ago but as their bank linking gets buggier and they move towards mandating manual transaction entry I moved on to another system. Still suggest the book to others, but the software got worse over time instead of better in my opinion.

Review.Titre: The automatic import is buggy at best
Review.Contenu: The automatic import is buggy at best. Constantly having to renew connection only to have it happen again next day.You are expensive.

Review.Titre: The old YNAB was absolutely perfect and…
Review.Contenu: The old YNAB was absolutely perfect and fit my family's needs. It turned us around financially and allowed us the control we were looking for. The new YNAB is not as easy to use, has issues at times connecting that cause us to play catch-up, and doesn't allow us to put our transactions in manually like we used to. I'm supremely bummed that old YNAB isn't available because it was a perfect product as-is (as-was?). We still use it but we're looking for something that works like the old YNAB used to with manual entry and control.

Review.Titre: Using the app was going well until…
Review.Contenu: Using the app was going well until automatic upload of my transactions were not able to be done. It has to be done manually or with a bank import until the issue is resolved. This has lead to some inconsistencies in my budget that I did not previously have. I’m looking forward to the automatic upload being available soon, as without it the app loses some of the appeal for me.

Review.Titre: I like Ynab a lot
Review.Contenu: I like Ynab a lot. I actually have a friend who has been helping me to really get it and I am really grateful for her. I think Ynab could use her teaching. She rocks for people like me who are not spring chickens and have been baffled by spreadsheets and all

Review.Titre: I wish I could give a 5-star review…
Review.Contenu: I wish I could give a 5-star review because for the most part it’s been amazing. However, with the whole Plaid and Amex not syncing that has been going on ever since I joined, it’s just been a little frustrating. Other than that, it’s the best budgeting software out there!

Review.Titre: Great premise, ongoing import issues
Review.Contenu: I love the premise of YNAB, the philosophy, the ability to parse out my current money into sinking funds. However, over the past 6 months I’ve had ongoing issues with my bank transactions not importing, importing as cleared when they had not cleared, or importing as not cleared when they had cleared. If his has resulted in me spending literal hours to reconcile my accounts. I’ve had ongoing contact with YNAB help and although they have always been friendly, this issue doesn’t seem to spark any sense of urgency and they remind me that I can just not use direct import and log everything manually. I know that’s an option, but the direct import is a key reason I use YNAB.

Review.Titre: Just started using ynab at the…
Review.Contenu: Just started using ynab at the beginning of the year. I have Fidelity which seemed to be out of commission at the time so it was difficult for me to learn the platform correctly I think. Overall i think it is aligning my finances well and lets me have a better view into what is going on. I was doing nothing previous to using ynab. So we will see how I like it as the months go on and if it makes a difference with my spending and saving.There is room to improve the use of venmo transactions and make it smarter and more seamless.

Review.Titre: Difficult for ADHD people
Review.Contenu: It's super nice, but as a person with ADHD it's impossible to keep at it and catch up again. I know I can reconcile accounts, but for one reason or another I always wanted to put everything in and that was too tedious. I need methods I can stop and start without too much hassle.

Review.Titre: Confusing
Review.Contenu: I have been trying to figure it out and it is very confusing. I have been using excel and can't figure out how to translate what I have in excel to YNAB. I renewed, but this is the last year for YNAB if I am unable to get it going.

Review.Titre: I like YNAB but have had problems mostly with reconciling and using the more in depth part of the program
Review.Contenu: I like YNAB but have had problems fully using it.  I liked it when customer service could respond to my questions in real time before I forgot what my problem is.  I'm getting more comfortable now so will give YNAB one more try

Review.Titre: The old program was better
Review.Contenu: The old program was better. The whole SAAS model just sucks and is so heartlessly greedy, it makes me sad. One of the only good things about the new app is that it syncs with your bank, but it's also behind, it cannot even connect to one of my credit unions, and I have to reauthorize it much too often.

Review.Titre: I have been using YNAB for over 6-7…
Review.Contenu: I have been using YNAB for over 6-7 years, and it is the best money-budgeting app. But unfortunately, YNAB needs to meet the requirements of the modern world. Two of them are multi-currency and crypto assets.

Review.Titre: Great budget app with some room for improvement
Review.Contenu: I have loved using YNAB because it budgets the way that I budget. I was so happy to find an app that rolled over the left over budget money in each category. It is how I have budgeted for 30 years and now that YNAB has come alone what use to take hours to budget each week now takes minutes. Yes, I talk highly of the app so now you are wondering why I only give it 3 stars. YNAB gets 3 stars because it struggles with importing transactions from your bank at time. YNAB has always fixed the connection but sometimes it takes a month or two. It gets frustrating having to go manually import your transactions for so long.It also does not have a way to look up past transactions in a report or be able to summarize and analyze your collected data. It would be nice to be able to run some reports and do a transaction search.

Review.Titre: Very simple tool at an exorbitant price
Review.Contenu: The idea of budgeting is good and works well. I gave up on it after several years using it, when they started doubling the prices, like today. There is no reasonable relation between the service offered and the monthly cost of 9-15 dollars. It is just a simple website and everything has to be done by yourself.

Review.Titre: Nice service, if you live in the right places.
Review.Contenu: Considering the exchange rate for USD/BRL, YNAB sadly became too expensive in the past few years for Brazilian users, considering they only focus outside of here. Despite Brazil being at the edge frontier in terms of banking technologies (to the point where other countries come to learn from us), and the widespread adoption of OpenBanking technologies and APIs, to use YNAB in Brazil is to be manual.Other than that, if you live in places where YNAB invested in the automations and interfaces needed, it must be really amazing.And despite all that, their philosophy is amazing and can be applied anywhere, but requires discipline. Their videos are amazing lessons for life, doesn't matter if you use their app or not.

Review.Titre: AMEX connector broken
Review.Contenu: AMEX connector is almost always broken, so you have to reconnect it constantly and the transactions are delayed. Still a good personal accounting software, if you’re willing to put in a ton of hours to learn it.

Review.Titre: Does not give users the option to…
Review.Contenu: Does not give users the option to deficit rollover across months. This is different from the original YNAB, and makes it extremely difficult for users whose credit card statement dates do not follow the calendar month, or who practises debit in the first month and subsequent credit/reimbursement in the next month. In general, app is not flexible enough to cater for different user behaviour, and simply assumes that people who rollover deficits are simply outspending their budgets, which is not true in all cases, as my examples above illustrate.

Review.Titre: Credit cards are just too hard to…
Review.Contenu: Credit cards are just too hard to figure out. There has to be a way to make that more intuitive.On my mobile device when I open my budget it populates the current   month. On my desktop it populates a much older month, I have to input current month.

Review.Titre: When you go from unique to run of the mill
Review.Contenu: When I first started with YNAB I could hit the QUESTION MARK button and there was an option to speak directly with someone. Now it's just some useless robo pig mascot. It's not helpful, and I don't even bother. It's not an improvement.

Review.Titre: A big step down from YNAB classic
Review.Contenu: I first started with YNAB classic many years ago and it did wonders for my bank account. It helped me move to a point where I was living on last month's income and I couldn't not have been happier. That version didn't require a subscription, just a few Dropbox account. Eventually the app stopped syncing with Dropbox and I was forced to "upgrade." This new version doesn't have a few of the features that helped me the most. I can't set up my budget for next month. I have to allocate my funds in the same month so I can't just lay out next month's budget to get a sense of how much I'm going to need. All in all, I'm disappointed with the new version of YNAB. What used to be a one time payment around $20 is now a yearly fee around $100 and the experience has actually degraded for the cost. It's still a useful utility but, is a shadow of what it used to be. I would get rid of it to save money but, I haven't found anything better yet.

Review.Titre: Too Clever by Half
Review.Contenu: This app started out many years ago with a clear and simple user experience.  But now it’s got so many bells & whistles that I’ve stopped using it.  It’s gotten ‘too clever by half’ for me.

Review.Titre: CC function could be better
Review.Contenu: I like ynab alot however, if I get messed up with the credit card function, I give up. What messed me up was attaching credit card and bank accounts. When I decided to reverse it, it was near impossible to figure out so i gave up and stopped. But I'd love to use it again. This function is just not very user friendly for me.

Review.Titre: Love it, suggestions to make it better
Review.Contenu: I wish I could see the same level of reports on the app as i do on the desktop. in particular my spending in individual or combined categories. Overall love the app. The other issue i find, although i have no solution, is that if i order something on my credit card and do not pay it off in time before the end of the month, the debt carries on my credit card account but does not show up in the next month as a debt that needs to be paid in the category the expense was tied to. For example, I spend $100 in gas on 4/29/23 and it will not show up on YNAB till roughly 5/2/23, which makes sense. But now the debt has been incurred in April with no way for me to know other than me tracking my credit card debt like a hawk. One workaround i found was to change the expense date to sometime in May to bring that credit card expense into the current month so i can tackle it. I guess making us aware that our debt didnt go away bc we're in a new month with a notification would be cool or perhaps keep that debt on the category and carry it over in the category, much like is done with the credit card account.

Review.Titre: It’s OK
Review.Contenu: I find managing a credit card reconciliation at times confusing. Also, I wish their support people were available more hours of the day.

Review.Titre: Trying to keep up
Review.Contenu: The program is really robust, and I appreciate that... But sometimes it is really confusing to follow what to do and how to do it correctly. Even after watching the tutorials...

Review.Titre: I used the suggested solution, but .....
Review.Contenu: I used the suggested solution, and I am experiencing the same problem, I am still trying to solve it so I can receive automatic financial information from my Credit Union. The message says that the data were accessed and transmitted within the last hour or so, but I have no additions to my checking or saving accounts. Frustrated.

Review.Titre: Definitely the best budgeting app I…
Review.Contenu: Definitely the best budgeting app I have ever used, I just wish I could see my spending history in a certain category easier and past months spending.

Review.Titre: This is a complicated App
Review.Contenu: This is a complicated App, to say the least.  It is easy to link to your accounts to import data and expenses , but it is not user friendly. I literally had to watch how to videos every time I friend to use the App.  It was a gift from a family member and I tried for two months and wanted a refund, but they won’t do it.  There are easier Apps that are free.  Don’t waste your money

Review.Titre: It’s not flexible
Review.Contenu: It’s not flexible.  Lots of issues

Review.Titre: Easy to use
Review.Contenu: The app/website is easy to use, but the bank connections are more often broken than not which makes matching expenses with actual transactions more time consuming.

Review.Titre: Import is unpredictable
Review.Contenu: I know they try their best but as banks improve security the import stops working consistently and I fall behind and eventually give up minding my budget.

Review.Titre: I do not use it to its capacity as the…
Review.Contenu: I do not use it to its capacity as the program is too difficult to work so I just make it up to suits what works for me.

Review.Titre: Linked accounts do not work well always…
Review.Contenu: Linked accounts do not work well always have to reconcile which misses Amy reports

Review.Titre: Incosistent and costs is high
Review.Contenu: cost became too much and inconsistent connection to my bank. made budgeting difficult and hard to justify the increase in the price of the product.

Review.Titre: YNAB: The least worst budgeting tool, but still limited and frustrating
Review.Contenu: Credit card payments remains an arcane feature that I wish I could just turn off.  The transaction filtering feature is very limited and will frustratingly reset every time you change another filter (e.g. if you filter for a time range, and subsequently filter for a transaction type, the date filter will disappear).  A lack of a robust tagging system forces me to use my own codes in the memo which is time consuming and produces incorrect reports when I make a typo.  Finally, the inability to carry over negative category balances month to month remains an infuriating feature.  YNAB's philosophy has dictated this experience, NOT customer feedback.  It's very Apple -- "We know better than you."  I've sampled many budgeting apps over the last 15 years and can say they're all lacking fundamental functionality and sort of suck in irritating ways. YNAB is the best among them, but being the best of the worst isn't exactly a great claim.

Review.Titre: Great product, but…
Review.Contenu: YNAB as a service has had an extremely positive impact on my finances. I think it’s a great product that works well for me, and many others. Normally I’d give them 5 stars, but in recent years I’ve been unable to recommend YNAB to friends/family due to a number of changes I’ve seen. The big one being, random and large price increases with poor communication regarding the changes. The price is a pretty large barrier to entry and tough for me to recommend at the latest price points. From an end user perspective I’ve seen these increase fees go towards trying to onboard new customers instead of add features long time users have been asking for. I’ve also seen new features come out in an unfinished state (such as the loan tracker) which caused me to have to use a lot of workarounds.Overall it’s a great product, but with the random, giant price jumps and lack of features that benefit long time users, I keep my eye out for alternatives.

Review.Titre: The most annoying thing of this is the…
Review.Contenu: The most annoying thing of this is the lags and delayed transaction imports. With its price. It made me just stop using it.

Review.Titre: I was an avid fan before they moved to…
Review.Contenu: I was an avid fan before they moved to the web platform. Since then, they've mostly increased price. Still a pretty good program but if I didn't have years of history saved, I'd probably look into alternatives.

Review.Titre: My bank transactions are still not…
Review.Contenu: My bank transactions are still not syncing! Disappointing.

Review.Titre: Has been stagnant for years
Review.Contenu: Has been stagnant for years. Problems with syncs, price increases happen every year.

Review.Titre: You Need To Budget for this App
Review.Contenu: Subscription price has increased significantly, so savings accumulated through the app just went there 😐

Review.Titre: Price is too high
Review.Contenu: The app is great, but for a budgeting app, the price is a way too high.

Review.Titre: YNAB not interested in U.K. customers
Review.Contenu: This product is fine if you fit the pattern of user for which it’s designed. It’s pretty inflexible otherwise. As mentioned by another reviewer, their automatic bank sync service is very unreliable. I think the reason for this is that they do not use the modern Open Banking protocols which make the service work well. They have told me today that they have no intention of updating this. Their only interest is in North American systems so I am going elsewhere after having been with them for many years.

Review.Titre: Using credit card is a pain.
Two issues
Review.Contenu: While the software itself is quite good I have two negative things to mention:1. In the classic software you were able to overuse a budget category (lets say -100 on Electricity as you had to pay something in advance). And then the next month this was calculate together with your budget. (so for example -100 from the last month, budgeted 100 for this month and another 50 used in this month would lead to 50 budget). This is no longer the case in the new online version. The budget from last month is only used if it is a positive value. This does not work with the way I am budgeting.2. It is simply to expensive. I'd say around 30-45$/year would be ok, but not 84$/year.

Review.Titre: Might be time to move on…
Review.Contenu: I have enjoyed YNAB for years. But I haven’t used it regularly for close to a year because of the inability to sync my bank account, University Federal Credit Union, with YNAB. I have tried several times without success, and there are no known issues listed. Sadly, I’m about to cancel my subscription.

Review.Titre: Losey customer service.
Great tool
Review.Contenu: Great tool. Lots of flexibility to create categories and organize. Only downside is that accounts need to be relinked more often than I would like.

Review.Titre: Awesome app some things are confusing…
Review.Contenu: Awesome app some things are confusing but they are very helpful

Review.Titre: The app is amazing and does exactly…
Review.Contenu: The app is amazing and does exactly what I need it to do as an envelope budget system. I tried lots of other budget systems after mvelopes folded and disliked them all except for YNAB. My one complaint is that I cannot write notes on particular transactions. But otherwise I love it.

Review.Titre: Easy to understand great envelope budget online
Review.Contenu: Very easy and user friendly app if your looking for an online envelope budget system. I have had minor issues with the syncing with my bank account but I believe that is because YNAB uses Plaid to make the connection. Also adding a credit card was confusing to me. I couldn't wrap my head around how it handled CC transactions vs payments. The whole CC thing just seemed backwards to me.

Review.Titre: Good Budgeting Tool
Review.Contenu: I started using YNAB over a year ago after the budgeting/envelopes tool I used closed. For the most part, I love YNAB. The user-interface is easy to understand. As a tool, it helps keep the budgeter on track and committed to goals. In general, tools like these are great for those who want to get Credit Card rewards, yet also pay off their credit card balance every month. Having not started YNAB with consumer debt, I cannot speak to how quickly the program can help someone get on track financially, but in principle, YNAB is designed with financially freedom in mind.My only reason for giving 4 stars instead of 5 is for some of the higher level, complex budgeting options, not currently available that I would love to see YNAB offer. For instance, I often have to pay for items and then submit a reimbursement through my employer. I know that I will have the money, as it is not really money spent out of my own budget, but YNAB has no good method for that. Rather, I have to submit preemptive deposits to keep my account from appearing overspent. I imagine that most people do not need the type of function I mention, but for me, this is a small frustration with YNAB.

Review.Titre: Real good with a few room for improvement areas.
Review.Contenu: Customer service is 5 stars.  They are quick to answer questions.My issue is pulling up history of my budget AFTER inputting into YNAB.  You can search and bring them up but it isn’t intuitive.  I just want to highlight a budget category and all the things that I put  in that category should then be seen.  Doesn’t work that way.Also if you make a mistake, it is hard to correct.  You can’t fix an error if you are using an iPad or iPhone.  You have to use the computer browser version of YNAB to make corrections and then you can only perform corrections if you haven’t refreshed your budget session.Annual price is reasonable.Other than the things I mentioned, I like it.

Review.Titre: Best budgeting app! Response time and overspent rollover process needs work
Review.Contenu: Overall best experience I've had with a budgeting app, it's the only one that works for me. However, there were some bugs this year when I switched my FNBO password and YNAB stopped conecting to my bank for a month or more. I didn't like that I couldn't call anyone and it took several weeks to get a useful human response. Also, I don't like that YNAB won't carry over a negative account balance into the next month. If I assign my money over multiple months and I over spend in a category this month, after it changes to the next month I have to go to the last month I assigned money to because it takes it from there. I don't know if that makes sense but it's a weird and confusing process. It's still a really great service and I appreciate it a lot. Also, love the new branding!

Review.Titre: We are coming from Mvelopes
Review.Contenu: We are coming from Mvelopes which was perfect for us.  YNAB has been the best solution we have found.We only have one real complaint.  We have been budgeting well for 30 years and do the right things. :) I understand WHY YNAB has it up for the utmost accountability.  Our issue is that we budget for the year. Each month is an average of what we need to budget per month. If we go negative in gifts in May because we have 5 birthdays and Mother's Day, we know it will settle out in June because we only have Father's Day. It would be VERY helpful if you had a switch in settings to allow us to carry over a negative balance in a budget category to the next month so we can settle it up easily.  We currently have to keep an additional spreadsheet to even things up month to month. This is our one complaint and it is why we continue to look for a different program that creates less work for us. However, this is by far the best we have found so far.

Review.Titre: YNAB is amazing and user friendly. Wish it had a couple more features.
Review.Contenu: This App is Amazing!!! This app makes it very easy to know where money is and how its set aside and I love how in the weeds it lets me get with my budgets. There are a few of things I wish it did a little bit better. 1 - I wish it showed me more easily the Totality of my budget across months. So I have them broken down into categories and all that but I wish there was a report that gave me that insight. 2 - in conjunction with the first, I wish it would take the income planned for periods and let me know how that compares to budgets so that if there is a budgeting issue it should alert me. 3 - I wish it almost had the ability to make a money assignment profile. What I mean by that is that I get paid semimonthly. I wish I could create a couple of profiles to say when I get paid way A I distribute money one way. When I get paid way B I distribute money this other way.

Review.Titre: Helps us talk about our finances
Review.Contenu: Me and my partner have been using YNAB for more than a year now and it's perhaps the most important software we've ever used. It encourages helpful conversation about our finances and always seems to give us a feeling of "enoughness" as long as we budget.

Review.Titre: What I love about YNAB is that it stays…
Review.Contenu: What I love about YNAB is that it stays in touch with how much money I have left at all times, and communicates that. It's simple and clear and easy to use. Both the online and mobile apps function well without glitching. I'd like to see a clear summary of the goals on the budget page that helps me to quickly assess whether my goals all fit within my income. I'd like to have this without searching the web and downloading an extension.Great work y'all.

Review.Titre: Great app but…
Review.Contenu: Great app, sad I can’t keep a picture of my receipts inside the transaction. Maybe you can, but haven’t been able to do it.

Review.Titre: Great product
Review.Contenu: The budgeting functions are fantastic. My only issue is that my bank kept getting disconnected. Seems to be working really well now though! I like being able to categorize my money so easily.

Review.Titre: Super helpful to keep track of spending and saving
Review.Contenu: Using YNAB has been so helpful in being aware of where my money is going. I have both a personal budget and a business budget, and I love that I can easily toggle between them...while keeping everything separate. The ONLY thing that feels lacking is the mobile app reports. I'd love to see a breakdown of where I'm spending the most money. I can see it on the desktop version, but having more reporting options on mobile would be so helpful.

Review.Titre: YNAB Turned My Finances Around
Review.Contenu: One Year YNABer.YNAB turned my finances around and, for that, I will always be grateful. It did this by providing four simple rules and a tool to help implement them. The key is visibility and having the information to make decisions about money.There are times where I don't understand why YNAB is working a certain way and not "my" way. While I think the unofficial forums are kind of useless for any kind of support or even how-to's, the official support has been real good. The answers are not realtime but once they get on the case they figure out what's going on and can explain it.There is kind of a learning curve but if you understand the envelop system of budgeting and can embrace the four rules then YNAB has a chance to make a real difference for a new budgeteer.

Review.Titre: I absolutely have been loving YNAB!
Review.Contenu: I absolutely have been loving YNAB!! It has helped me visualize all my money and allowed me to spend and save systematically. I recommend it to EVERYONE I meet, as I’ve tried many other budgeting apps and truly nothing compares to YNAB. It was definitely a learning curve at first, and I did put a lot of work into learning it, and I would say that there are some minor kinks that could be worked out, like sometimes I’ve had to connect my banks multiple times before it really saves, but honestly, I love how they are always trying to make YNAB better for customers! Thank you YNAB!

Review.Titre: Great tool
Review.Contenu: It is 4, because for me there is no multi currency in one budget, banks integration in my country, slightly more expensive than competitors.But it is a great tool, I'm using it for over year now, it helps me track everything and I'm happy with it.

Review.Titre: YNAB has made a big difference for my…
Review.Contenu: YNAB has made a big difference for my finances and is a platform that really lets me see what is happening with my money. But the constant GUI changes are frustrating sometimes.

Review.Titre: great except...
Review.Contenu: Great, except one big flaw. My mortgage is a biweekly payment, and the app doesn't seem able to do anything other than a monthly mortgage payment, so that is disappointing and it makes my mortgage tracking inaccurate. This should be addressed, since the app is about saving money and a biweekly payment is the wisest financial choice that will save you money over time.

Review.Titre: It's better than just a spreadsheet
Review.Contenu: YNAP is better than the old spreadsheet because either of us can access it online whenever needed. Using YNAP has improved our relationship with our money and made it really easy for us to set and work towards money goals.I wish it synced with more banks, I still have to do a lot of manual transactions.

Review.Titre: Love the app
Review.Contenu: Absolutely love YNAB. I have it as my browser homepage and use it to make sure I'm always looking at where my money is. The system is invaluable for me, and helps with my compulsive spending and gambling addiction issues. Connections break sometimes but less than Mint and some others I've tried. One thing I'd like to see improve is integration/support for the YNAB toolkit. Many of the features I rely on are customizations from there and it breaks sometimes.

Review.Titre: YNAB has been such a great tool in helping me save money.
Review.Contenu: YNAB has been such a great tool to help me see where my money had been going and an even better tool to help me budget my money in a way I never had before.I will say that I absolutely HATE the new approval bar. It makes no sense for it to be at the bottom of the page when it appears since the transaction I'm trying to approve is at the top of the budget. Other than that, I just don't like it.

Review.Titre: Control over our finances at last
Review.Contenu: We are so much more in control of our finances since we started using YNAB, we have 'sinking funds' and savings pots set up and we've started trying to save towards our kids future and our retirement. I don't really use the reports as I don't find them very useful but seeing where our money goes each month has been eye opening!

Review.Titre: Love ynab mostly except for the…
Review.Contenu: Love ynab mostly except for the reporting....it's quite vague it definitely needs improvement. It seems like it's hard to see where you've spent your money out of each category. Plus the overall reporting is not great when you down load it to excel

Review.Titre: YNAB is great for computer-savvy seniors who need to understand their finances
Review.Contenu: I am a senior citizen and have been using You Need A Budget for several years to help me manage my money. YNAB is a great way to track your spending. Just set up your accounts (checking, savings, credit cards, big ticket items like mortgage and auto, etc) and then record each transaction you make. Secondly, set up your budget and assign the amount for each weekly, monthly, and yearly expense and you’ll quickly see where you are over-spending. Understanding how credit cards work with YNAB is somewhat confusing but there are helpful YNAB tips and YouTube videos. YNAB is somewhat time consuming but once you get in the habit of recording your daily transactions it becomes easier. I recommend You Need A Budget because it gives me an organized “big picture” of my finances.

Review.Titre: Great budgeting app
Review.Contenu: Great budgeting app for my personal but also companies purposes. There is only one annoying thing that for Polish banks it messes with transfer titles and payees.

Review.Titre: Virtual classes available but, limited support
Review.Contenu: For me, there was a steep learning curve to YNAB - including one failed attempt.  Fortunately, virtual classes/YouTube videos are now available but, live support is limited.  I advise new users to join FB support groups for help, from other users.

Review.Titre: You pay for the education, not for the app
Review.Contenu: With YNAB, you pay for the education, not for the app itself. There's a lot of videos, tiktoks, articles and podcasts: from “How do I edit transaction date?” to “How do I make long-term financial decisions?”And as educators, they're great.

Review.Titre: Fantastic service but Expensive Outside the US
Review.Contenu: Fantastic service.  It has really helped my wife and me with budgeting.  The culture around the service is also nice with some of their videos presenting a sort of corny positivity to budgeting.The only problem I have is payment in dollars.  It is getting harder to justify the cost in my local currency, especially when a lot of the features like automated transactions are not available in my country.

Review.Titre: I’ve enjoyed the experience for the most part
Review.Contenu: I’ve enjoyed the experience, but my partner who uses a different bank had to abandon YNAB, because every time they’d try to use it, all their accounts would have to be reconnected and it was a huge pain. Calls to YNAB and the bank could not resolve it. So I can’t use YNAB for couple expenses, and that sucks.

Review.Titre: Was better when auto import worked
Review.Contenu: Would have been 5 star if the automatic import still worked. Since August you now need to reconcile each account for 3-5 minutes in order to see transactions. You need to do this every time you use the app. Huge waste of time for an expensive product

Review.Titre: My Experience with YNAB is generally…
Review.Contenu: My Experience with YNAB is generally fantastic. I've seen a wide range of benefits after starting to use YNAB ranging from reducing my spending, all the way to being able to save thousands of dollars faster than I ever have before.Some features that would be really helpful to have would be:1) a way to export my budget from the mobile application2) More reports available, and way to customize those reports          2.1) Some reports that are able to make projections (if I save x amount then this is what I will have in N months, for example)3) Increased variety of savings/goals, and ways to customize those

Review.Titre: Worth the learning curve
Review.Contenu: Took a little while to understand all the bells and whistles (and I still probably don't know them all). Flexible enough to track very detailed spending information. Possible to set up a budget in another currency. Has helped us track and understand our spending. I appreciate the many videos answering common questions.

Review.Titre: I have been using YNAB for years
Review.Contenu: I have been using YNAB for years.  It took me a long time to switch to the updated version because I didn't think I could justify the cost.  However, I am very happy with the product.  I know exactly where I stand and if I have questions the customer service is quick, and efficient.  The people in customer service know their product well and have outstanding communication skills.  The only reason I did not give a perfect score is because of Plaid.  Plaid is the only issue I've had to contact customer service.  The on going training sessions are done well with clear explanations on how and why we budget the YNAB way.

Review.Titre: We've saved thousdands of dollars!
Review.Contenu: I love this app!  We've saved so much money by being able to visualize where every dollar is!  Overall the basic features are easy to jump in and use.  I know there are other features that we're not taking advantage of.  The app is both simple and complex at the same time.

Review.Titre: App is good, but has AMEX syncing problems
Review.Contenu: The app is great. Very helpful and easy to navigate. I love creating categories and love how it does all the math. I'd recommend everyone to learn how to budget with this app. Con: For 1 year I could not reconnect my AMEX accounts despite multiple attempts to delete the AMEX accounts and reconnect. The delays and not being able to reconnect ultimately made me not renew.

Review.Titre: I love how easy it is
Review.Contenu: I love how easy it is. I like that all my transactions are automatically put in my budget for approval, and the algorithm suggests which budget to take from. I was doing my budget in excel until YNAB, and switching has saved me so much time and headache. The only thing I wish that was different, is it didn't zero out any negative balance at the beginning of the month, and that the Credit Card payments were easier to understand and manage.

Review.Titre: Neat tool but bit pricy
Review.Contenu: YNAB's training resources are a life saver. They have videos/articles explaining literally everything to do with budgeting. I think the price puts a lot of people off though so would like to see a longer trial period, cheaper subscription, lifetime subscription, or just other options in general because it's such a life changing product!

Review.Titre: Curb overspending and see where your money goes
Review.Contenu: YNAB helped us see where our money was being spent when budgeting was new to us. In the years since, it has helped when the budget is tight (hello student life & mortgage) and is ensuring we keep track of things now that we have greater cashflow - yay for jobs and graduating! We expect to need to buy a new car soon, and I suspect using YNAB has been instrumental in us having the cash to buy one without finance.(We've been using YNAB for probably 8-10 years now.)

Review.Titre: Great software
Review.Contenu: Great software. I have been using it for many years! The newsletters are actually helpful, their website has a lot of good information and it made budgeting so much less scary for me. I constantly recommend YNAB to my friends. The only real drawback is that I can't integrate it with my non-US bank, so I have to add all transactions manually.

Review.Titre: Amazing tool - Give every dollar a job concept is brilliant
Review.Contenu: Takes any stress and worry out of money and budgeting. Amazing budgeting concept and tool which has massively helped us to get on top of our personal, and also our household, finances, meaning when an expense/bill comes up needing to be paid, it's very very rarely unexpected or unplanned for, we know the money is sitting there ready to go :)Only four stars as we did have an issue with it duplicating transactions when our bank accts were linked so we've removed them and it's fine

Review.Titre: Good but not Perfect
Review.Contenu: Ynab is a fantastic platform, the fact that the main focus is on budgets helps a lot with financial control. The only problem I see today is that there is no expense report in the mobile app, it is only present in the web version, and I really miss it in the mobile app.

Review.Titre: YNAB is great for keeping our family on…
Review.Contenu: YNAB is great for keeping our family on the same page with our budget and saving priorities. The user interface is easy to use and looks great. We have experienced some challenges with the automated imports from our banking institutions. Usually it’s fixable by reconnecting, but we have had to do manual export/import a few times.

Review.Titre: Not always intuitive but help is…
Review.Contenu: Not always intuitive but help is availableI tried a few way to track our expenses in a cohesive way and so far I find this to be the most flexible although not always intuitive. It is well documented and being improved regularly and the team makes themselves available to resolve issues one may face. I wish I didn't have to look up so much information on some unique features that I do not find intuitive like how they track the value of an asset while paying off the related debt.

Review.Titre: I’ve been using YNAB for over a year
Review.Contenu: I’ve been using YNAB for over a year now and it has been the only budget app that I’ve really ever stuck with. The zero-based system works incredibly well, and my wife even likes it since she’s used to cash envelope budgeting. The app and website are intuitive and powerful without being too overwhelming. There is room for improvement though, particularly in the area of reports. There’s only like 1-2 reports visible on mobile; and a very limited selection overall. A lot of people use the extension ‘Toolkit for YNAB’, but frankly we shouldn’t have to rely on a third party tool to gather useful info about our budget. They promised better reporting years ago and have yet to deliver. Also some more savings goals would be nice, such as a weekly savings builder, or adding a target amount to a savings builder goal - more options and flexibility is always nice.

Review.Titre: Good but delayed banking import is a struggle
Review.Contenu: I love the platform and feel it is helpful in streamlining our budgeting. However, we struggle with the banking delays to import and end up with duplicates from time to time that make it hard to reconcile.

Review.Titre: Mostly love it
Review.Contenu: I like YNAB and it’s helped us save money. Using a credit card in the app is difficult to understand, especially if you pay it off monthly (ie have no credit card debt). It usually ends up appearing like I’m overspending when I know I’m not based on my own checks and balances. It’s also $100 per year now which is a lot for some people.

Review.Titre: YNAB is a useful budgeting tool
Review.Contenu: I found that YNAB was a useful budgeting tool, which was quite easy to learn. I always received prompt and helpful advice from customer service.The only negative for me is the price. I found a cheaper product with auto feeds for all of my bank accounts, and includes budgeting and exceptional support.

Review.Titre: YNAB Is Awesome!
Review.Contenu: I love the functionality of the platform and it looks cool too! The mobile app and ability to share the budget with my spouse is also great. I wish there was a way to make hidden/closed accounts disappear from the category section since I don’t want to see “Hidden” or “Closed” after I no longer need them. Maybe put them in a larger menu tucked away from the main screens the users see? Anyway, that’s the only reason I didn’t give 5 stars. The tutorial and podcast videos are great too!

Review.Titre: Nice and clean user interface
Review.Contenu: Nice and clean user interface. I like it a lot in general and would recommend.It is still lacking in the planning ahead department however. But I get that their idea is to only spend what you have but the reality is that you have to plan ahead to have the money you'll need in months from now which requires to take in account your predictable revenus and create a budget that "fit".That process can be much improved. I already voiced my suggestions using the feature suggestion pipeline.

Review.Titre: It is very easy to use and set up
Review.Contenu: It is very easy to use and set up.  Three people in my family use it.  However, it's challenging to keep my Account the same number as my Bank Account number.  Also, it's not the easiest to pay for the year subscription via iTunes.

Review.Titre: Next level spreadsheet budgeting.
Review.Contenu: YNAB takes the spreadsheet budgeting to a higher, nerdy level that I enjoy. I've always did my budget on a spreadsheet. Adding formulas but never was able to get it to connect to my bank for transaction tracking. To know where my money is set aside gives me peace that things are covered.

Review.Titre: Best budgeting / money tracking…
Review.Contenu: Best budgeting / money tracking software I've used. The ability to plan future spending makes it so much more powerful than basic money tracking software. An automatic bank feed for Australian banks would turn this into a 5 star review.

Review.Titre: A useful tool that shows your FUNCTIONAL balance, instead of your TOTAL
Review.Contenu: This has really helped me see where my money actually is, instead of seeing only the total balance and thinking well maybe I CAN squeeze something extra in. Being able to see that all my bills can be paid, that I have enough for gas for the month, and whether I can pull from somewhere to afford something or not, it's relaxed a lot of my financial anxiety. I only gave it 4 stars because there are some things that I find confusing. Figuring out how to properly categorize and balance my credit card spending has been difficult. And sometimes it can be finicky and require extra steps to get it to register properly.

Review.Titre: Very good product
Review.Contenu: Very good product. Give me the confidence to spend money knowing the basics are covered.Would love to be able to link my bank account. As a french it isn't available yetEffectively, it is now possible to link french bank. (wasn’k possible 5 years ago when I started)

Review.Titre: So close to 5 stars
Review.Contenu: Overall, fantastic app. Only thing keeping me from giving it 5 stars is the connections to banks are often glitchy, or don’t work at all (especially tracking accounts like investments). If those got ironed out, 5 stars all day.

Review.Titre: This app is a life changer with a few faults
Review.Contenu: I love what YNAB has helped do to transform my financial success. Not only is it a helpful tool, but using YNAB has given me confidence in my financial plans and goals for the future.The only reason that I don't give the app 5 stars is because the app sometimes has a few bugs and the ways that the app calculate things are not always intuitive or how one would expect. On the flip side there are tons of videos on Youtube to help with this.

Review.Titre: I love YNAB but…
Review.Contenu: Im using YNAB many years and it’s absolute help me to organize my finances and balances. But I have to do a lot of In/Outcome Inputs manually. No one German Bank is supported automatically sync in YNAB. That’s one feature what could make this Software perfect.

Review.Titre: Overall, I love YNAB.
Review.Contenu: Overall, I love YNAB. I just wish I had a little more custom control over the target types.  Other than that, it's helpful and easy to use.  It has made financial discussions with my spouse easier.  It has given both of us a better picture of our money.

Review.Titre: good for data collection
Review.Contenu: I like that this app collects data on my spenidng. I don't particularly find it to be a good budgeting tool for a more complex family budget with multiple income steams and expence categories associated with each. It doesn't link with one of my banks :(

Review.Titre: I absolutely love YNAB!
Review.Contenu: I absolutely love YNAB and their budgeting system. I wish all of their startup tips and tricks were together in one startup guide pdf, but having videos and emails daily during the first week is cool too I guess. It has definitely changed

Review.Titre: Good tools and an intuitive layout
