Review.Contenu: Good tools and an intuitive layout. Really helps keep track of where money goes. Wish it didn't cost quite as much to make it more accessible to more people, it costs more than my email/vpn/cloud storage software, but it *does work well* and saves me money.

Review.Titre: Practical to keep a budget and to see…
Review.Contenu: Practical to keep a budget and to see exactly how to make your money work more efficiently to enable savings, budget for things and more important avoid overspending etc.Easy to use both on the computer and on Android, syncs well.However, still a bit annoyed that I bought that software years ago as YNAB 4 but it is no longer supported on the computer nor on smartphones and now I have to pay a hefty yearly subscription to keep using the online version with a mere 10% discount. That's not alright at all but I guess a clever way for the company to make more money rather than selling the software once to reach customer. Monthly and yearly subscriptions for everything now is a plague these days for all technology softwares so no choice I suppose but to yield.

Review.Titre: Nearly perfect budget tool
Review.Contenu: It is out of YNAB's control, but the connection issues with some institutions prevent me from giving a full 5 stars. The UX and structure are great, easy to learn, and have saved us tons of stress and money.

Review.Titre: We’ve used YNAB for a year and have…
Review.Contenu: We’ve used YNAB for a year and have found it to be generally useful, overall. It’s not super intuitive and it takes some work to figure out the angles, but after taking time with it, it’s really a good tool. The only thing that we still find frustrating is the bank updates are super slow. And the app doesn’t always sync well. Irritating but over all a good product.

Review.Titre: Great for Monitoring Expenditure
Review.Contenu: I think that the app is generally aimed as the less financially savvy than I as I'm still getting used to "only budgeting for the money I have," which can make it difficult to prioritise for long term goals (i.e. will there be sufficint funds for everything I have planned for the next 12 months, 5 years, etc.). I still love it! I have lots of finance and budgeting experience and have used spreadsheets to manage my budgets for many years, but YNAB is much more convenient.

Review.Titre: How do I undo on my phone?
Review.Contenu: My only concern with Ynab has been on the phone app, when I accidentally tap on all icon, and it moves money or some similar action. I don’t know how to undo the action. And there is no history/record of my actions, so that I at least know what I did. Apart from that, Ynab has been great. It has increased my net worth by thousands of dollars. I am very grateful.

Review.Titre: Overall a good program
Review.Contenu: Overall I like YNAB.  I find the web application clunky and frustrating to use.  I also find some of idiosyncrasies of the software frustrating - such as not carrying negative balances forward from month to month in budget categories.  I wish they had a non-web version.  Their staff is always friendly and responsive.

Review.Titre: Expensive, but so worth it to me.
Review.Contenu: YNAB has helped me organize my bills as well as helped me easily save money every month. The only reason for one less than maximum stars is they have increased their annual fee and it’s expensive.

Review.Titre: Expense Management and Income Categorization: Enhancements and Suggestions
Review.Contenu: I successfully categorized the expenses and created effective charts and tables, which was great. For further improvement, it would be helpful to have categories for income, similar to those for expenses, and to include support for anticipated income.

Review.Titre: I've been using YNAB for years
Review.Contenu: I've been using YNAB consistently for several years. It's been a fairly simple way to keep an eye on several budgets for myself, my family, and my businesses. The thing that continues to confuse me is how the credit card debt / payments work.

Review.Titre: Great budgeting tool for the consistent…
Review.Contenu: Great budgeting tool for the consistent budgeter. I only started budgeting back in November 2020, and didn't start using this app until January 2021. There is definitely a learning curve to this app, but I love that I can budget a month out and see how "old" my money is. I've considered using other apps, but I can't get over the ease of creating a budget and how my working budget goes along with me out and about.

Review.Titre: I love YNAB!
Review.Contenu: I love YNAB and recommend it to everyone. It shifts your whole perspective on money and budgeting, and it just makes so much sense (once you get used to it- give yourself time to adjust to that new way). Their customer service, educational materials, and support is second to none. My only bummer is the iPad interface. I replaced my beloved MacBook Pro with a new iPad Pro, and my YNAB experience has suffered a bit. It’s hard to get important reports, and articles and tutorials for all the things are geared toward desktop. (I’ve been told I can switch modes and more easily access my reports, but after several attempts I gave up.) These are small issues compared to the epic benefits. I’m sticking with YNAB and singing its praises to anyone who wants to listen. Give every dollar a job and it will change everything!

Review.Titre: Great Budgeting Tool
Review.Contenu: We were grateful to finally find a tool that would help us track our budget. We have used it for a little over a year now. One thing I wish YNAB would improve on is having a live person to talk to through their customer service. I  still have a few questions about reconciling my budget that I don’t know how to get answers for. I have watched all the YouTube videos, but I wish I could call and chat with someone. Other then that I have been extremely happy!

Review.Titre: Most beneficial budget tool I’ve ever used
Review.Contenu: I’ve been using YNAB for over a year now! Great tools and resources to help you learn how to use the app and makes budgeting waaaaay easier than it has ever been for me. Support groups, podcasts are also so helpful. Overall such a beneficial experience I’ve recommended it to all my friends

Review.Titre: I love YNAB and look forward to more reports
Review.Contenu: I love YNAB, it’s a wonderful tool that has made budgeting much less difficult for me. I wish there was a way to export from it, to allow me to do more reporting. I would love to look at monthly, quarterly and annual expenses to see how I’m spending and how I can do better. I’m always looking for ways to improve my finances, so better reporting is the only thing I can think to add, or a simple export option to allow me to create my own reports instead.Maybe it’s already available and I’ve not explored the tools to find it, and if that’s the case then it’s maybe just hiding from me. I’ve tried exporting or even copying my spend from areas within YNAB in order to build reports, and I haven’t been successful.

Review.Titre: I had a hard time at first, but now it is such a blessing. I love YNAB!
Review.Contenu: I had a hard time at first. I do not understand the basics of budgeting, but you had so many YouTube helps that I could go to that helped me get started. I stopped and started over again many times. But eventually I finally got the hang of it. I needed a budget so desperately and this was the only program that really helped me. It seemed logical and I was not going to give up. Your self helps were so useful and they did help me set up my budget. Also, your Customer Service help was useful, although I wish they were easier to get hold of.It has now been a year since I started using YNAB and I recommend it to everyone. It has helped me to live within my means and as a retired person who only has her Social Security as her only source of income, this has been a blessing.

Review.Titre: YNAB is the best budgeting app I’ve used.
Review.Contenu: YNAB is a well-made budgeting app that covers most of the bases and is not difficult to learn. It is a very helpful tool oriented towards budgeting every dollar.I have used Mint, Every Dollar, and my own custom spreadsheets. This is by far the best experience I’ve had.YNAB gives you a lot of control and customization over managing the details of your budget, if you want that; but, it does so without being complex. You can learn the fundamentals in a few minutes. I would prefer a few more reporting capabilities, but many people will not need that level of information. My only gripe is a minor issue with syncing between the iOS and PC versions: the two apps mirror transactions exactly, but sometimes “approved” transactions in one are not marked as “approved” in the other, causing me to have to manually approve them on my phone and PC. This is a very minor inconvenience since you can multi-select transactions.

Review.Titre: by FAR the best budgeting tool…
Review.Contenu: YNAB is by FAR the best budgeting tool I’ve tried and used. I just reached my one year “anniversary” and for the first time don’t have regular anxiety over money because I see it in front of me, it is FLEXIBLE, and I know that every dollar has a job! Thoughtless spending has decreased significantly. My reason for 4 stars is that I wish the mobile app was slightly more user friendly (I would give anything for an “undo” button!), the “automatically assign” option always leads to a mess and me wiping my budget and starting from scratch, and it is not the best at catching duplicate purchases. (For example, I often use PayPal for purchases but it is linked to my checking account and without fail I get a separate deduction from each account and have to manually delete one. Not a big deal but it really threw me off at first and I could never keep my accounts reconciled. Now I just make sure my PayPal is always at zero$).

Review.Titre: The only reason I didn't give YNAB 5 stars…
Review.Contenu: The only reason I didn't give YNAB 5 stars is because of a fault of my own. I've been a customer for over a decade and a year ago I accidently deleted my account and had to start over from the beginning. I called support immediately but my 10+ years of data was lost forever. I wish YNAB had an account recovery feature. Other than that, I love YNAB.

Review.Titre: Enjoyable, but a steep learning curve
Review.Contenu: It made budgeting an enjoyable activity for me. To be able to have the numbers crunched and laid out so well is a huge help with organizing finances. There is a steep learning curve with the program and it took me almost a year to realize that I had been inputting credit card transactions incorrectly.

Review.Titre: Great tool, but expensive.
Review.Contenu: Great tool - unfortunately the price recently increased significantly. However, this has probably been the best tool I have used over they years to track finances and really allows me to control finances as well as track them (other options I have tried include Quicken, Microsoft Money, Mint, Personal Capital). Budgeting features here are the best I have seen

Review.Titre: Mostly amazing
Review.Contenu: I think it is great-it has definitely helped me to save money and be more goal focused.  My only issue was some bank connection issues that took several months to resolve and made things more challenging and the different type of connection I had to use wasn’t as reliable or automatic so I have to pay much closer attention - which is fine just not as “easy”.  Overall awesome and I tell everyone about learning to budget at 55!!

Review.Titre: A bit too expensive
Review.Contenu: A bit too expensive for my (non-US / non-Europe) country. Still, amazing app

Review.Titre: Educated spending
Review.Contenu: I love that YNAB has made it easier for me to make educated decisions about my money all in one place. By having those yearly expenses right in front of me, I'm no longer relying on memory to ensure I have enough money at the time it's due.

Review.Titre: Has room to improve
Review.Contenu: YNAB is a handy toolset and mindset for anyone who wants relief from financial distress.If the company can listen to users' suggestions and improve customer services. It will be more great.

Review.Titre: YNAB Comments
Review.Contenu: The support from your team has been outstanding.  Our only complaint with YNAB is the lack of reports available.  We really need a budget vs. actual comparison on a monthly and YTD basis.  If you would add that, the app would be outstanding!

Review.Titre: I love YNAB
Review.Contenu: I love YNAB. Just renewed my yearly subscription. I’m never leaving!! Lol the only reason I didn’t give 5 stars is because sometimes transactions take days to show up and the app and computer website don’t always sync well. We can’t all be perfect but I love it so much!!

Review.Titre: Mostly satisfied
Review.Contenu: I don’t like not being able to use some features from my iPhone and that there isn’t a person to call when there are issues but overall it’s a good tool

Review.Titre: Really great with a little room for improvement.
Review.Contenu: I really like the cash envelope system used and the way that all my accounts connect with ease. I would like it if it could connect live with my investment accounts to update maybe even just once a day. The price is a little more steep than I would like. I had it free for a year as a student and if I didn't have that time to get it all set up and really get in the groove of things, I likely wouldn't have began the service.

Review.Titre: I love the electronic "envelope"…
Review.Contenu: I love the electronic "envelope" system.  I nearly quit many times... found myself a coach that can share my screen.  I wish that there was a live person to chat with on YNAB.  Getting help a day later or even an hour later is really cumbersome (though appreciated).

Review.Titre: I still have issues from time to time…
Review.Contenu: I still have issues from time to time such as correcting a mistake like debiting from the wrong account and having issues trying to undo or correct it. Is undo even possible from the mobile app? If so, I haven't been able to find it.

Review.Titre: The app is easy to use
Review.Contenu: The app is easy to use. I like how I can fit it for my spending. I get paid weekly, which is unusual-but it’s no problem for this app.My only ‘issue’ was learning the credit card spending. Took me a bit to figure how to use — but once I understood — I love it!

Review.Titre: Mostly easy and fast to budget
Review.Contenu: Tracking spending is easy and fast between my spouse and I. Format is customizable to many budget types. However, bank data transfer doesn't work with our bank, and reconciling isn't the easiest process.

Review.Titre: YNAB is a great tool
Review.Contenu: YNAB is a great tool. It can be confusing at first, but there are plenty of video tutorials.  It is figure-out-able.  I read Ramit Sethi’s “I will teach you to be rich” book and he recommended YNAB, so I got it over a year ago and it’s a tool I check in on every 2-4 weeks. Categorizing everything made it really easy to figure up my tax write offs, which is awesome!There’s still a lot of features I don’t know how to use, but even without all of that, I have a much firmer grip on how my money is spent each month, and that’s a huge help!I definitely recommend it.

Review.Titre: I am a daily user of YNAB and it is a…
Review.Contenu: I am a daily user of YNAB and it is a great tool to track and monitor spending and budgeting.I would really like there to be more detailed reports, and for those reports tk be available on both desktop and mobile.

Review.Titre: Ynab is a pretty good tool and has…
Review.Contenu: YNAB is a pretty good tool and has helped me get more organized and learn about budgeting.  One thing is I think they’ve over complicated the software and budgeting.  If software is easy to use incorrectly, then the user will fall into a pitfall despite everyone’s best intention.  One example of this is that I still can’t believe there is not a budget interface in the system where I can see the whole year at once.  Just a spreadsheet basically with the columns as months and the rows as expense categories or income categories.  Then a subtotal column ect and final yearly numbers to have a full projection of a year.  Instead i have to export my budget to a spreadsheet and work with it in excel?  For a specific example, see how this property management software has a dead simple budgeting tool. help.buildium(dot)com/hc/s/article/Budgets So in summary I’m grateful to YNAB for helping me along my budgeting experience, as I use more book keeping tools and accounting tools, I’m realizing they overcomplicated some things and left out some important things.  Keep up the good fight YNAB.

Review.Titre: Invest in yourself, get YNAB
Review.Contenu: A great program that helped me go from living paycheck to paycheck to actually paying off a credit card and have a balance in my savings. The only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is because they tend to have a lot of connection issues with my bank and my transactions are consistently a week-ish behind

Review.Titre: I'm rating the experience of YNAB Wellness
Review.Contenu: I think YNAB Wellness is a GREAT option for a service provider like me, and customer service is great.  My only constructive feedback is on the billing.   It's unclear how/when we get billed, and the annual invoice was innacurate - for example, we got a link to an invoice for 5 seats in advance of the charge date, and then saw that transaction + another for additional seats that we don't have an invoice for.  In our case it's fine, but that may be problematic for other businesses that are more tightly budgeted and unclear about how the billing works for wellness accounts.

Review.Titre: A great tool for personal finance, but too expensive right now
Review.Contenu: Managing my personal finance using YNAB is both easy to setup as well as easy to manage and I'll not easily say such a thing.However the reason I stopped using is twofold. First off the price just about doubled for me, and while the application may be more worth the price when using more advanced functions like automated imports (which are mostly supported only in the USA), the price increase puts it well above the price of most other similar applications. Secondly, the main reason I used YNAB was because I had to properly budget to prevent myself from going into debt, which ironically means that by using YNAB I learned I shouldn't be paying over ninety euros on a service that is available far cheaper even if I think it worth it.

Review.Titre: Massive Time Saver & Peace of Mind
Review.Contenu: This tool is effective and efficient and saves me hours of precious “Saturday morning free time” each month I’d otherwise spend going through spreadsheets and account reconciliations. It gives me peace of mind that our budget is on track and also helps me catch fraudulent or questionable charges right away. I recommend YNAB to everyone.

Review.Titre: I have been using YNAB since 2009 and…
Review.Contenu: I have been using YNAB since 2009 and it is the best budgeting software by far, in my opinion.  I have gotten the "maybe the grass is greener" itch a few times and tried other software options, but I've always found my way back to YNAB.  It just works and the customer support is next level if you ever have a question or issue.

Review.Titre: Flexible
Review.Contenu: The best budget planning app that is getting better and better.I’ve tested many other budget planning but YNAB is most flexible and truly understanding people’s needs.Using it for over a year and very happy about how calm I became by not remembering what I need to spent my money on.

Review.Titre: Great tool
Review.Contenu: It's a great tool that is obviously made with a lot of attention to detail. I used Quickbooks before and I couldn't get used to it. YNAB felt right immediately.

Review.Titre: We have finally gotten our attention under control
Review.Contenu: This is the best app ever. I've used quickbooks, mint, honey, several others briefly and couldn't get under control but this one has a different approach and actually helped my husband and me. We've been using it a little over a year and I highly recommend it. Try for at least 4 months, you'll see.

Review.Titre: YNAB has changed my life!
Review.Contenu: I love YNAB. YNAB has helped me go from living paycheck to paycheck to having a solid emergency fund. It has changed my relationship with money completely.

Review.Titre: Can’t live without it
Review.Contenu: Easy to use and creates visibility to how my savings and spending is going. It gives me freedom to spend when I know there’s money in a category.

Review.Titre: We have been able to be in control of our finances.
Review.Contenu: We have been able to be in control of our finances, instead of the other way around. Less disagreements about what to spend where, we just check the budget and category to see what is available and make an informed decision as to spend or not to spend. Love rolling with the punches when needed. Less worries about unexpected things that come up, as we have it covered.

Review.Titre: Versatile Software and Caring Staff
Review.Contenu: I have had YNAB for about two years now.  This is the most versatile budgeting software I have come across.  You can customize your categories to the max!  And anytime I have reached out to YNAB with an issue or a simple thank you, I have received a beautiful and detailed response.  They care about each and every person who uses their software- not just as customers, but as human beings.

Review.Titre: Best thing ever!
Review.Contenu: It has changed my life by changing the way I look at and utilize our money. We've been able to pay off debt, save for the future and go on vacation. None of this would have been possible without YNAB.

Review.Titre: After 1 year of using YNAB
Review.Contenu: After 1 year, YNAB has helped me determine what my unnecessary expenditures were and told me where my money's mostly going. This has definitely improved my spending habits and I hope my savings are also going to improve very soon!

Review.Titre: Excellent budget app easy to helps…
Review.Contenu: Excellent budget app easy to helps track credit purchases and payments seamlessly. Easy-to-fill envelopes each month and know what is left in each envelope daily.

Review.Titre: YNAB is a game changer
Review.Contenu: Budgeting only with money you have is counter to all of the advice I grew up with and had encountered before YNAB, but it’s revolutionary and the level of peace I feel being a month plus ahead is priceless.

Review.Titre: Seriously easy to use and super helpful!
Review.Contenu: We had a bank that wasn’t easy to connect, and the support team created a way to make it happen. This program is so helpful to keeping to a budget. Everything works so intuitively. And we just don’t know how we survived without it before!

Review.Titre: YNAB is phenomenal!
Review.Contenu: YNAB is such a help in our personal finances. We have an accurate understanding of where our money is going. The program has a learning curve, but the supports available to teach you are very helpful. It's worth every penny!

Review.Titre: The tool is so helpful!
Review.Contenu: The tool itself is such a helpful tool in general. Customer service takes a little while to get back to you but when they do they go above and beyond to help explain things to you or fix any problems.

Review.Titre: Successful switch from Mint
Review.Contenu: We have been users of Mint for over a decade. Sure I had to do a lot of manipulations to make it work but it was free! However, I had forgotten to balance the budget before the end of the month one too many times and decided to try YNAB. Its super easy to use, they are always working to make it better and when I have had questions I couldn't figure out they have a great support team that has looked into my individual issue and figured it out. We also have taught a lot of people over the years to budget and this tool is much easier to explain.

Review.Titre: Easier than I expected
Review.Contenu: So much of the work gets done automatically. It took me a few months sorting out what categories made sense for me, but then YNAB picked up what stores went with what category so I rarely do more than add a comment and approve them. Unprovoked I have tried to get others on this app. It is outstanding. Budgeting is life changing. I am retired on a fixed income and it lets me balance my big expenses like travel against emergency expenses like car repair, lets me get the most out of y money.

Review.Titre: Best budgeting app I have ever used.
Review.Contenu: Best budgeting app I have ever used.Pros:-It is hands on. You need to be logging in at least once a week (I do it daily). This means you actually use it as a budget and not a tracking system that runs in the background and you look at once a year after the spending has already taken place. -The software forces you off the credit card float. Which before YNAB I didn't even know I was on. This means I can pay off my credit card bill in full at any point.-No guessing. You know where your money is, and you know exactly what you can afford, and what you can't.-Great for couples who share finances. Each person has their own log in, and multiple accounts can be linked to YNAB.Cons:-The import feature is a bit gimmicky and doesn't always work. There are other options for importing transactions, and YNAB tech support is fantastic, but still, I wish it was better. -Reports could be better on the web, and they are basically non-existent on the app. There is a web extension called "Toolkit Reports" which bridges this gap, but for the price, I don't think I should have to rely on random web extensions. All in all though, this thing is worth it.

Review.Titre: YNAB is the best way to manage your budget!
Review.Contenu: We love YNAB! Their customer service is incredible and they offer so many classes and resources and sessions to give feedback on their product and make sure you know how to use it in a way that will really serve you. I love how easy it is to track credit card payments and what you owe and ensure you have all the money set aside to payoff in full. We will continue to use YNAB for the long-term (hopefully forever)!

Review.Titre: Best budgeting tool I've ever tried
Review.Contenu: Best budgeting tool I've ever tried, and I've tried a few.  It really helped me change my relationship with money and to be able to save for both expected and unexpected events in the future.  I'd say it took me about 3 months to get the hang of it and two develop the categories I needed with the help of perusing the Reddit YNAB subreddit and things agree going smoothly a year into the process.  At first, I scoffed at the cost, but honestly it's with every single penny to know where my money is and where it's going.  I recommend not linking accounts and doing everything manually so you really stay in touch with every transaction you make.

Review.Titre: highly recommend!
Review.Contenu: YNAB is easy of use and excellent customer service. It’s helped me approach my finances with less anxiety, and I’m so glad a friend recommended it a year ago! The fact that I’ve stuck with it that long says a lot!

Review.Titre: Love the app!
Review.Contenu: • app is very user friendly• desktop is not as intuitive for me, but has more reports available so I use it for spot checking about once a week•love that I have to reassign overspending instead of just ignoring itPrevious to using YNAB I had a system where I was a month ahead on bills so I would have a large amount of money in my account but it was clunky because I would have to manually figure out how much I still needed and for what bill, etc. Now YNAB takes care of that and I always know which item for the next month is still short.  Overall super pleased with YNSB’s system.

Review.Titre: Tools for success
Review.Contenu: With a good support team, clear how to articles, rock solid principles and an easy interface, YNAB provides not just a good idea for personal financial success but the essential tools to achieve it.

Review.Titre: The best budgeting app I have used
Review.Contenu: The best budgeting app I have used. Completely changed the way I handle my money and has helped me pay down my debt tremendously

Review.Titre: This app has been a live saver for me
Review.Contenu: This app has been a live saver for me. Since using it, my networth, savings, and investments have gone up exponentially just because my finances are more organized. Thank you YNAB!!

Review.Titre: Take you money under control
Review.Contenu: The new approach, well, It's not that "new" anymore, so rather a unique aproach to deal with money, debts and be less stressed of the furure.

Review.Titre: Exactly What I've Wanted
Review.Contenu: This software does EXACTLY what I've wanted since 2000 in every way! It manages the "envelope" system digitally and sets aside money for credit card transactions as you categorize your items according to your budget!

Review.Titre: This app is truly life changing
Review.Contenu: This app is truly life changing. Our family is in the middle class bracket. Make too much to get any assistance and we make too little to really make it. This app has shown me where we spend too much so i was able to make the adjustments needed to give us a better financial life. I am still a work in progress but i am making progress.

Review.Titre: YNAB makes it easy
Review.Contenu: YNAB makes it very easy to meaningfully track our household budget

Review.Titre: Must needed tool!
Review.Contenu: Been using YNAB on and off since 2015. I've tried other apps but always come back to YNAB.  It's definitely improved my relationship with money. YNAB should create a financial education course to be taught in high school!

Review.Titre: Worth the money
Review.Contenu: I'm using YNAB for a year and I have really built savings for the first time ever. It works for me because it is flexible and easy to use and it is easy to deal with impulse buys or unexpected circumstances.

Review.Titre: Life changing.
Review.Contenu: This app literally changed my life.It’s more than just a great app, with a breathtaking user-friendly beautiful interface, an amazing community, and the most impressive personal finance management tool, it’s more than that. It’s a true life concept, which drastically revolutionized my entire view and mindset of what personal finance management is and should be.I am literally addicted to this app, and I could not live without it. Ever.

Review.Titre: Use the free trial to understand the method
Review.Contenu: I recommend using the free trial to its fullest to understand how YNAB works, because it's much more useful if you follow the underlying principle.It was a little daunting at first and expensive when compared to other budgeting apps, but when I tried to used others, they felt lacking, like I was just making an effort to record transactions without actually getting useful or actionable information from it.

Review.Titre: Simply fantastic
Review.Contenu: YNAB got me through college when I was unexpectedly on my own for survival, including tuition. Even though I had inconsistent income, massive tuition bills, and a host of other things to worry about, YNAB had me handled. I've saved gobs of money and feel confident about my finances now because the Four Rules really work.On top of the app itself, their website and support are extremely helpful, with lots of articles and help on anything I've needed. I'm currently planning my wedding with YNAB too. As things stand, I will be sticking with these guys till the end of time 🫡

Review.Titre: Financial Clarity!
Review.Contenu: YNAB has changed my life financially for my family. Financial clarity over expenses, habits, and life’s surprises make the burden of budgeting a breeze. I look forward to looking at my YNAB budget everyday and constantly recommend it to friends and family.

Review.Titre: Using YNAB over year and loving it
Review.Contenu: I'm using YNAB for our a year now and I'm happy to say it worth every penny because it helps me, and us as a family, manage our finance in a way bank applications cannot.The biggest difference is by building and following a budget we can be prepared for things we don't want to happen but know might happen and also better understand what we can and cannot afford.Even if we have money in the bank, without YANB it's hard to know what this money purpose is.Using YNAB we know exactly how much money we can use for each thing.

Review.Titre: YNAB presents a clear at-a-glance view…
Review.Contenu: YNAB presents a clear at-a-glance view of cash flow. It’s allowed me to invest more, keep spending aligned with our values, and easily roll with the financial punches that are inevitable. It takes some time to set up and figure out the approach because YNAB looks forward at spending, not backwards. Once set up it saves SO much time. It also greatly reduces worry because everything is so clear. Lu moved to YNAB 18 months ago and love it!

Review.Titre: Change your life, Choose YNAB
Review.Contenu: We've been using YNAB for the last year and it has really changed our lives by changing our relationship with our money. I was into budgeting before my wife and I got married, with most of it being with EveryDollar and the folks of the Ramsey network. The people at YNAB are just more supportive, understanding that how people want to spend their money is as varied as the person who earned it. We don't get yelled at for NOT living on rice and beans, or using credit cards responsibly, and we don't get berated for spending money on the things we enjoy WHILE we pay off debt. And if we decided to sprint, the folks at YNAB would still be there to support and cheer us on. Because they're so damn awesome. I get to watch our net worth go up as we pay down debt, save some money here and there, and we do this all while being encouraged to think about what we want our money to do for us. The only thing I'd like to see added to the Income and Expenses report is an approximate savings rate each month and annualized as well. The Age of Money is awesome as well. MANY thanks to Jesse and the YNAB crew!

Review.Titre: The software is the best we have used
Review.Contenu: The software is the best we have used. Helped us fine tune our budget management.

Review.Titre: Mvelopes convert
Review.Contenu: Switched when Mvelopes closed. This is way better than Mvelopes in many ways - and only worse than MVelopes in a couple ways. My main complaint is that I want to carry a negative balance on envelopes from one month to the next. I use that to indicate when people owe me money. YNAB doesn't like that. I understand why, but it makes it harder for me to deal with it.

Review.Titre: I absolutely love YNAB
Review.Contenu: I absolutely love YNAB and can’t imagine handling my finances without it. The ease of being able to see all your money (checking, savings, credit cards) in their own category and then summarizing everything into a budget tab is great! I also love the addition of loan pairing so when you make a payment, the loan amount goes down so you can see your progress. It also has a simulator that allows you to see if you made additional or lump payments, how much quicker your loan due date will decrease while saving interest. There’s just so much about this that I love. You have to try it! It really will change your life and give you a better relationship with your money.

Review.Titre: Great for “envelope” style budgeting
Review.Contenu: This is the only online budget software that I found that does zero-based, envelope style budgeting, which I believe is the best way to not just know your spending, but to actually manage it. Besides that, it’s easy to use, fast, and both the mobile and web experiences are good.

Review.Titre: We love YNAB
Review.Contenu: We love YNAB! When bills come I don't get anxious, I know it's covered in YNAB. It's brought a lot of financial peace.

Review.Titre: Best budgeting app…hands down.
Review.Contenu: Love YNAB.  I couldn’t live without it at this point.  I was an mvelopes user for years.  Once that app was discontinued, I tried numerous alternatives and YNAB is head and shoulders above the rest.

Review.Titre: I Love YNAB
Review.Contenu: I Love YNAB! There I said it! I have always done a "budget" but YNAB allowed me to have the insight as to where I want my $ to go. By planning in advance, giving each dollar a job, it works very well for my style of spending. It took a couple months to transition from a paper budget to YNAB but now I cant imagine doing it any other way.

Review.Titre: I love the flexibility to create my own…
Review.Contenu: I love the flexibility to create my own groups and categories. The only thing I wish YNAB had is a spending plan to automatically fill my envelopes based on how I plan to spend the money. That’s not a deal breaker though.

Review.Titre: Able to save for big yearly expenses now!
Review.Contenu: We started using YNAB because we wanted to save up for big yearly expenses and a 20 yr anniversary vacation. Now a year later, we have reached those goals and we are managing our money better than we ever have our entire lives. Thanks so much.

Review.Titre: Best budgeting app ever!
Review.Contenu: YNAB has given me so much confidence with my money. I feel so prepared for anything that might come up, I paid off all of my credit card debt, and I’ve learned how to prioritize saving and spending goals. I love how it connects to your bank and credit card accounts so it’s easy and quick to stay accurate. I will never give YNAB up, it’s the best budgeting tool out there!

Review.Titre: Try it, you won’t regret it
Review.Contenu: I had been using another platform for a long time. When they shutdown I found YNAB. Admittedly it took some getting used to, but now I love it. It integrates with my bank and credit cards seamlessly. I have been able to get 1.5 months ahead with funding my budget. Funding is simple and flexible.

Review.Titre: Extremely helpful
Review.Contenu: There’s a learning curve, but tons of helpful videos and also tons of live webinars where you can ask questions. Every person has been friendly and helpful. The app works well, has plenty of flexibility to use it the way you want to, and is extremely helpful in keeping you aware of all transactions and on track.

Review.Titre: It took some getting used too
Review.Contenu: It took some getting used too, but when getting the hang of it, It’s been really great at being mindful at what my money’s being spent on. Also the budgeting automation has been great at taking the guess work on when, what and how much to pay towards bills.

Review.Titre: I love to use YNAB
Review.Contenu: I love to use YNAB. I have been using the method of just over a year. I had be budgeting with a different program for years, but after starting to use YNAB I have been able to get over a month ahead and am out of debt.

Review.Titre: YNAB IS LIFE CHANGING!!!
Review.Contenu: YNAB has genuinely changed my life. I can’t imagine my life without it. I love how they not only provided a platform to budget, but they also provided their 4 rules of budgeting. Those rules with the tools provided from YNAB has given me the most amazing financial freedom I’ve ever known. I actually know where every cent of my money is going, and if I have money to spend on something. It’s allowed me to save more than I ever have. I love it and am so grateful for the work they have done! They’re saving people’ finances in my opinion.

Review.Titre: Can't imagine myself managing my finances any other way
Review.Contenu: I've been using YNAB for just over a year now, and it has genuinely changed my mindset towards personal finance. It has enabled me to keep a tight grip on what my money does, and to better align my spending with my goals and intentions.I sincerely cannot imagine myself managing my money any other way. I highly recommend YNAB!

Review.Titre: Review of YNAB after one year
Review.Contenu: About a year ago, I was looking for a new method of managing our budget. For many years we were using Quicken and for a number of reasons decided it was time to leave, their app and lack of interest in customer issues related to the app being just one. After searching YNAB appeared to be the best choice. We were already trying to follow a zero based budgeting stategy so the transition to YNAB wasn't that difficult. Not saying it was seemless, but with the help of the many video tutorials the transition went pretty well. Needless to say, we just renewed our subscription for another year. YNAB is easy to use, clever in how it handles your budget needs, and provides updates as needed in a timely manner. Another thing I personally like is how rapidly the team responds to questions when something occurs that I cannot figure out on my own. The mobile app is quick and easy to use and actually makes it enjoyable to enter transactions at the time they occur.

Review.Titre: Great customer service and free classes! Thank You!
Review.Contenu: Customer service and your free classes!  Your podcast is great too. The ease of use of your mobile app helps me also stay on top of a complex family office when I’m on the road. I recommend YNAB to our friends and family - it has been a complete game-changer for us helping me to stop my vagueness around money.

Review.Titre: No longer afraid to look at my bank account
Review.Contenu: YNAB has been extremely helpful with teaching me how to budget. It has forced me to take ownership on what I allocate my money to and the ways I could be saving or paying off debt faster.

Review.Titre: Excellent product & excellent service
Review.Contenu: Excellent product & excellent service!  After over a decade using another budget service I made the switch to YNAB when they shut down a year ago.  After 1 year with YNAB, I only regret not moving sooner.  YNAB is a great place to reach your goals & it has the right team to just keep making it better.

Review.Titre: YNAB is a game changer
Review.Contenu: YNAB is a game changer.  It allowed me to save thousands of dollars in my first year of use.  As an independant business owner, my income fluctuates, and because YNAB allows me to give every existing dollar a job I am able to ensure my budget no longer relies on future income.Make the investment.  Use YNAB's endless resources to evolve your budgeting methods - between YouTube and the podcast, YNAB provides so many tools to help you curate a budget that makes the most sense for you as an individual.I wish I would have found YNAB sooner.

Review.Titre: I love YNAB
Review.Contenu: I love YNAB! They keep me on track. Not to mention the extremely responsive support staff for all of my questions around maintaining my budget, how to work different situations  and credit card usage. Truly enjoy the platform.

Review.Titre: Love Love love YNAB!!!
Review.Contenu: Love! Love! Love! Ynab . . .It's my 4th year and the learning curve was a bit tedious in the beginning. So happy that I stuck to it cause now I can't imagine what my finanacial life would be without it!  I am on a very limited budget (fixed income)  and since on YNAB I can even save a few $$$.  Who would've thunk???? LOL   Love the new "SNOOZE" feature!  Thank you again!

Review.Titre: YNAB is a great budgeting tool
Review.Contenu: YNAB is a great budgeting tool. It allows you to create a plan and allocate your funds so you can stay on track. The training videos are helpful and the courses they offer help with any questions you may have. I love the program and recommend it to all.

Review.Titre: Time saver over Google Sheets!
Review.Contenu: Time saver over Google Sheets!I switched to YNAB just over a year ago. After much research, I found that it aligned most closely to our family's financial philosophy. It has been a huge time saver over my Google Sheets system and is more accurate and up-to-date to boot. Love the educational support and community, especially the "Budget Nerds" podcast. Highly recommend!

Review.Titre: YNAB has changed my life!
Review.Contenu: I've been using YNAB for a year now, and it has completely changed my finances. I tried different budgeting systems but this is the one that's stuck, thanks Team YNAB

Review.Titre: YNAB is the best!
Review.Contenu: I used to mvelopes which I thought was great. But they went out of business. I tried many tools to replace it. YNAB was by far the best out there. I could not manage my budget easily in this day and age of online transactions without it.

Review.Titre: YNAB is AWESOME!
Review.Contenu: I have ADHD and struggle with spending. My husband and I share an account. It has really helped me realize the amount of money I have in my checking account is ALL spoken for in one way or another! My husband looks at the bank account online and I look at YNAB to see how much we have to spend on fun things, bills, extra debt payoff, etc. This app has really been life changing for me to build skills to think of my money differently.  I'm not perfect in my spending, but this method has worked very well to see how much I have spent and that an extra I spend has to be taken away from something else.

Review.Titre: YNAB is a huge help for my ADHD
Review.Contenu: YNAB is a huge help for my ADHD! It's hard to make money feel "real" sometimes with ADHD and plan for the future, and YNAB has helped me keep perspective and keep money feeling more real and give me a better reminder of consequences if I go off-budget. It's helped me weather some sudden financial changes and keep future bills in mind. I absolutely love it!

Review.Titre: Using YNAB has been one of the best…
Review.Contenu: Using YNAB has been one of the best decisions I have made in years regarding my finances. Before YNAB i had absolutely zero clue how to budget and often tried to keep it all in my head. Simply looking at my account balance and trying to plan for the future did not cut it. YNAB instilled a philosophy around money that has led to me feeling the most confident about my budget I have ever felt. YNAB works, but it is an intentional tool in your daily routine and is well work the effort. Also, the program and apps work well with no complaints. The bread and butter is how YNAB forces you to face reality and not spend money you don't have.

Review.Titre: Thank you YNAB for enriching my life! :)
Review.Contenu: I have been using YNAB for a year now. While I used to loosely track my expenses with a spreadsheet, I quickly got used to the YNAB system and it's incredibly easy with the links to my bank accounts to track every penny I spend. I have significantly more money in the bank now than I did a year ago which I attribute to my ability to really see what I'm spending every month and to plan ahead better. At the beginning I found the YNAB tutorials useful and also found helpful videos online which got me fully up-to-speed quickly.

Review.Titre: I don’t understand it, but it works!
Review.Contenu: I’m not sure how it compares with any other programs, but it has done the trick. I don’t know how it all works exactly, but I’m getting ahead on managing my money after YEARS of struggling.  THANK YOU!

Review.Titre: YNAB is the best mix of complex and simple
Review.Contenu: YNAB is the best middle ground between complex and simple. It seems like every feature I need to be able to use when I have some kind of obstacle in my budget is handled already by a feature of YNAB. It’s always just a matter of learning it, and usually it’s intuitive enough I don’t need to look up a guide. The only criticism I have is the lack of ability to connect certain cards (my Kohl’s credit card, for example).

Review.Titre: The best approach to budgeting with the most reliable app
Review.Contenu: Before YNAB I had always _tried_ to pay attention to money and make sure I was not spending too much. But YNAB is now the only way I can think about money and cash flow simply because it is so good.YNAB have built an _incredible_ app that as long as you stick to it could dig anyone out of the messiest financial situations.

Review.Titre: Wiser with money thanks to this app
Review.Contenu: Very easy to use. It has helped me to have real control over my expenses and to think more wisely regarding money allocation. The only thing I think it lacks is more freedom to do reports...existent reports are useful but I have liked to see other things and have needed to use excel instead.

Review.Titre: Support got back to me promptly and…
Review.Contenu: Support got back to me promptly and they knew what the problem was . They also told me if their advice didn’t work to contact them again

Review.Titre: 10/10 Would Recommend
Review.Contenu: Life changing. Been using it for a year and a half. Savings skyrocketed, money management has improved, and I feel happier and more stable financially through the help of YNAB's software and educational resources. It's a lot to learn up front but if you stick through it, it's such a low maintenance service that works wonders. Helps me focus on more important things in life and not stress out about money regardless of my circumstance.

Review.Titre: Obsessed with YNAB
Review.Contenu: I am obsessed with YNAB in a similar way that I am obsessed with music. I have never before been able to keep money in my account beyond a two week period. Now I never have less than a few thousand, and I’ve only been using it for a year! It’s actually one of my favourite topics and I’ve rambled on about it to total strangers. I’ve got my mom, husband, and friends onboard because I am so passionate about it that they’ve had their interest peaked and subsequently their finances drastically changed for the better. I definitely fall under the category of a budget nerd and yes I do listen to the YNAB related podcasts. I never thought I would say that budgeting is one of my passions but here we are thanks to YNAB.

Review.Titre: Helpful in all ways
Review.Contenu: Helpful in all ways. App works great. The “thinking” / philosophy behind it just makes your brain and emotions “get” what you are doing when you budget. I'm out of credit card debt! Forward on my mortgage and comfortable even with rising rates. AND I still get to go out, buy things, travel or splurge at Christmas.

Review.Titre: Ynab is easy to use and fun
Review.Contenu: Ynab is easy to use, and for all of us who have their money (finally) under control: a lot of fun to play with.

Review.Titre: YNAB changed my whole money game!
Review.Contenu: When I started YNAB a year ago, I knew I was in for some education. My finances were a MESS. I was living paycheck to paycheck and not achieving any goals. Once I started YNAB and using the budgeting method, I came to some hard realizations. I had to make some major adjustments, including entering a debt management plan for my high interest credit card. I am now for the first time EVER, making steady progress to pay down my debts and take control of my financing. I am so grateful for YNAB for showing me the way.

Review.Titre: Amazing Employees, Awesome Product
Review.Contenu: The best thing about YNAB is their awesome customer service! Anytime I’ve had a question it’s been answered quickly, and the help they provide through videos and live Q&As is incredible! I’m a student who tried YNAB for a year free and it saved me way more than the subscription cost by getting me to rethink how I approached my budget and taking most of the work out.

Review.Titre: The best way to budget and save money
Review.Contenu: YNAB  uses the cash envelope system.  Best way to understand your spending and cash flow.

Review.Titre: Makes Budgeting Easy
Review.Contenu: Makes Budgeting EasyThis helps our family manage our budget together. It is easy to use the program on the computer or in the app. It helps us plan for short-term and long-term goals. I also manage my elderly father's budget. It is easy to toggle between the two budgets.

Review.Titre: Great tool!
Review.Contenu: This app was originally a little bit tough to use. They have wonderful resources about getting started and how to use the platform but it’s also semi simple enough to feel like you don’t need them. Despite that, after getting the hang of it (and restarting maybe twice along the way) it turned out to be a huge help to managing my finances! It became easier the more I used it and helps me keep an eye on my spending.

Review.Titre: YNAB gives you financial clarity for a stress-free future
Review.Contenu: I've tried many budget apps and methods but none provide the instant visibility and understanding of your financial posture like YNAB. I wish I would've stuck with it when I first had it in 2012. I would've had a nice retirement account by now. YNAB is a gamechanger.

Review.Titre: I'm rich!
Review.Contenu: I've been able to organize and prioritize my spending in ways that other apps failed. I can setup spending and savings goals and plan accordingly.In the year that I've been using ynab, I'm 100% debt free and my net work, excluding retirement funds, tripled.

Review.Titre: YNAB changed my relationship with…
Review.Contenu: YNAB changed my relationship with money. It helped me better understand where I was spending and reign in the chaos of reacting to my bills vs being proactive with my bills. I was able to build a plan and harness over 17k in debt. Now we just maintain and plot along.

Review.Titre: Budgeting that builds confidence
Review.Contenu: I was able to see what I was doing wrong throughout my budgeting career, That all things can be prepared for when you know what job your dollars are doing. Very intuitive way to understand money and cash flow.

Review.Titre: I love how customizable this platform…
Review.Contenu: I love how customizable this platform is! I can tailor it to perfectly meet my needs and easily make changes along the way. I have better control managing my finances and greater peace of mind being able to track my saving and spending goals.

Review.Titre: Great website!
I’m a visual learner
Review.Contenu: I’m a visual learner, and seeing the YNAB bar graph change was a huge motivator to save money and pay down debt!

Review.Titre: YNAB makes it fully transparent
Review.Contenu: YNAB makes it fully transparent - glad to use it on a daily basis

Review.Titre: Friends who are advocates
Review.Contenu: Friends who are advocates. Blogs. Videos. Lots of helpful resources.

Review.Titre: Never looking back
Review.Contenu: I was used to organizing my expenses with the envelope system, but it got out of control the less cash I used. My boss recommended YNAB and I love it, once again I have control of where my money is, no matter how many accounts, cards or cash I have. Thank you YNAB team!

Review.Titre: I LOVE YNAB!!!
Review.Contenu: I LOVE YNAB!!!! It's created such an easy, straightforward way for me to manage our family's household $, make legit plans, and feel so much confidence around money in general. Seriously, I'm a huge fan.

Review.Titre: YNAB is the best budgeting app/software…
Review.Contenu: YNAB is the best budgeting app/software I’ve used. The consumer service is 2nd to none. Great value.

Review.Titre: YNAB Removed my excuses for poor budget management
Review.Contenu: YNAB makes managing my budget and my money easy! Period! The category groups, categories, reports, the integration with banks and credit cards to get transactions, and their support is polite and quick to respond. Plus, they teach you how to use the product and how to have a budget and why! Amazing!The mobile app is amazing! Having my accounts AND my budget in the palm of my hand is invaluable! I can be out and about and need to buy something and just grab phone to see what I have in that category and move things around if needed.I have tried a lot of different tools, including making my own, YNAB has been the best and easiest to learn and has all of the features I needed when it comes to managing my money. YNAB removed the excuses for me to not have a good budget and to not manage it well. Dang you YNAB! :) And also, Thank you YNAB!

Review.Titre: Accessible yet robust…
Review.Contenu: I’ve tried several budgeting strategies but never stuck with anything until I tried YNAB. They do a great job balancing ease of use with some robust and nuanced features. On the days I don’t feel like diving in to my financial situation, I often smile when greeted by ‘I like big budgets and I cannot lie’ and other similar messages. It’s a relatively small thing but it makes it fun. The tutorials are super helpful when getting started. The basic tracking of income and expenses is very intuitive but I’ve found the asset and tracking capabilities to be super helpful for envisioning the future. The reports function is another great feature that I’ve found a great deal of benefit from. Keeping an eye on your ‘age of money’ over time has been a real eye opener for me. I will definitely be sticking with YNAB and highly recommend it to a lot of people trying to maximize their financial chops!

Review.Titre: My favorite app of all time
Review.Contenu: My favorite app of all time. Don’t know what I would do without YNAB.  One of those priceless apps. The 99 I pay a year saves me thousands by budgeting smart. Well done YNAB

Review.Titre: I’m loving it
Review.Contenu: I’m loving it, I feel like I have so much more awareness.  Reach out to the military.  This would be an excellent option/training for young service members to learn how to build budgets and spending plans early in their careers.
